content:
Posted: October 2, 2014
												Nazi Dinosaurs with Cannons and Machine Guns on their backs. What more do I have to say?Dino D-Day is a humorous WWII Multiplayer FPS about what would happen if not only did Adolf Hitler's science teams brought the dinosaurs back to life, but also gave them nerve controlled weapons, the intellegence to comprehend language, ideology, nationality, and not eat their masters? You get this silly game where Dinosaurs have cannons, machineguns, their own claws and abilities, and even suicide bombing mini dinos; I'm not kidding. The game got it's start as a single player mod for Half Life 2, but it was scrapped apparantly and it's assets turned towards a multiplayer game. There are two teams, The Allies, and the Axis. With some memebers of either having special abilities to use.The Allies are John Hardgrave (The Leader), who uses either the M1 Garand or the M1 Carbine. His ability is when he gets three kills, he can go into a Patriotic beserk spree! Punching facists with his super fists high into the air! Then there's Joe Spencer, he uses either a Tommy Gun or a Grease Gun, his specialty is calling in artillary strikes onto a part of the map, which is useful for either clearing a certain chokepoint of enemies, or dealing damage to critical targets. Up next is Nigel Blythe, English Gentleman with a Shotgun, and his choice of either a rocket launcher or a flame thrower to light those jerries up! Supporting from the rear is Ilona Vike, cute as a button but sharp as a razorblade. This Soviet Rose is the sniper of the team and utilizes her rifle, her revolver for back up, and a dead rabbit to distract certain dinos into losing control and eating, leaving them vulnerable to either Ilona herself, or her comrades. Supporting at the front is also Camille Brun the medic, she heals nearby teammates with her special or can chuck heal oozing medpacks for teammates to gather around. Finally, there's Trigger, the wonder dino! Liberated from the Nazi Army, Trigger is the only Dino the allies have, and he's as deadly as he is cute, getting revenge on the long long hunt from carnivores millenia ago, Trigger uses his nerve controlled, swivel mounted 30. Browning Machine Gun on Facists, wether beast or man.The Axis forces only have three humans, being mostly comprised of Facist dinosaurs!  Kurt Streicher is a simple soldier with no abilities to speak of, Armed with his rifle, his MP40, and some grenades, he does good on the front on his own.Karl Hissman is the more interesting German, being a falconer, he's trained explosive, suicide Pterosaurs to fall onto where ever he points at, killing anyone nearby (Did I mention you can, if lucky, lock the Pterosaur onto an enemy?). Aside from that, he serves as the team's sniper against Ilona.The final Human is Don Graff, the Medic and Vetrinarian for the Axis war machine. be wary that even though he is a simple medic, he is armed with an STG44.The Facist Dinos include the classic Velociraptor, who can use his speed to surprise and overwhelm enemies, and even pounce onto them to rip their throats out.The Dilophosaurus can pick up one of the many goats (did I mention there's goats in this game?) and lunge them at enemies for damage and laughs, as well as the ability  to knock down enemies, pick them up, and toss them for a double kill!The Desmatosuchus is a walking tank, armed with a medium but still powerful tank turrent, he can supress enemies and kill with splash damage. Be mindful that he and his spikes are big, so it's not easy to get through certain doorways.The Stygimoloch is the Desmatosuchus, but more mobile, agile, less bulkly, and has a MG34 Machine gun instead of a cannon. He is the German Trigger.The Microraptor can do it all! He can fly, claw people to death when they don't know it, and blind people with a deadly acid spit, while clawing them to death!The Compsognathus, or Compy for short, is a suicide bomber dino, though small and his bomb is just a stick grenade, he is still fanatical, and with three kills from his claws, turns his grenade from a weak firecracker, to a powerful bomb that can kill many, and set others aflame!Finally the grand daddy of them all, only avaliable on certain maps, The Tyrannosaurus Rex! You can't spawn as him, rather there's a "waiting list" on the Axis team where a random player gets selected to become the Rex until either the end of the round, or death where upon another player is randomly chosen. He is nasty, Armed with two MG42s on the sides of his head, able to pick up and toss airplane bombs, he also uses his might roar to knock down enemies and if they're unlucky enough, The T-Rex can pick them up and eat them for health! His only problem is his pure size and slowness, making him a target for everyone.The game comprises of three modes. Team Deathmatch (First team to 50 kills wins), King of the Hill (The side that controls the hill point for 3 minutes wins.), Control Points (First team to capture all points wins.), and Objective mode. Otherwise the game is your typical FPS combat, with the Allies being more for group tactics and shooting, while the Axis Dinos are more arena shooter.Overall this is a fun cheap game, I got this for $1.99 when it was on sale the other day, and it's worth the money if you can find a crowded server. The game is active with a couple of players, so no worries about finding a big game. I would indeed reccomend this game.Pros:-Fun Gameplay-Gunplay is good-Dinoplay is amazing-CheapCons:-Weird Control choices (Holding the aim button while in toggle mode won't let you fire your gun, this can be switched to hold down though.)

number of helpful: 123 of 140 people (88%) found this review helpful18 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 18, 2014
												The tide of World War II is about to change. Dinosaurs have been resurrected by the Axis to be the formidable foe against the Allies. I bought this game years ago and went in thinking it was a single player first person shooter. You vs dinosaurs! Maybe I should read descriptions. Dino D-Day is a multiplayer online first person shooter set in the 1940s. There are 9 maps to choose from and a server list to find a game. You can even play offline or alone with bots and its every bit as fun.The teams each have their own characters. I hesitate to say classes, because everyone feels unique. Sure both teams have a medic, but they're both different. Each of the 16 characters are different and relegated to humans and dinosaurs. The Axis has six dinosaur characters and three humans. The Allies have six humans and one dinosaur named Trigger. The dinosaurs have longer stamina to run around the map, so they don't run head on into gunfire from humans. Humans are weaker, but to balance it, they're smaller. The bigger the dinosaur, the more health it has. Changing between characters is easy like Team Fortress 2.The dinosaurs all play differently and it doesn't take that long to understand how they work. Maybe 10 minutes to be effective and efficient killers. Trigger, on the Allies side plays in 3rd per-dinosaur. He can jump and use a machine gun that needs to cool down. On the Axis, there's a Stygimoloch that plays similar with a cool down machine gun. Desmatosuchus is a slow tank that takes a lot of damage, fires very slowly and murders quickly. To balance him, he's a slow mover and so wide he can't fit through normal doorways. There is a raptor that is fast, plays in first per-dinosaur, melee kills quick, can leap, a high jump and pounce with the alt fire button in the air. A bigger dilophosaurus in 3rd person that can quickly run and head ram things to death. Not just that, it can pick up one of the goats found in most maps and heave them at the Allies. Compsognathus is the smallest third person dinosaur. Because of this, you're under the sight line of most humans. Your lack of health is gained in stealth. Plus, you can simply explode at will. Its beautiful. The final dinosaur is the Microraptor that plays in first dinosaur. It has wings and while it can't fly it can flap to keep it in the air to spit acid that blinds enemies. Not just that, but it can cling to walls and ceilings. Cling, but not wall run or anything like that.It is the gameplay diversity and the uniqueness of all characters that really set this game apart. The humans all have their own weapons that not only feel good to use, but effective too. Most of the weapons except the shotguns have iron sights with their alt fire button. On the Allies, you have Hardgrave, with a gun, a pistol, a grenade and his bare fists to box with dinosaurs. Spencer has his primary weapon, a pistol, his fists and a sticky bomb. Lob it out, stick it to an enemy and watch as they bring it home. Piat is the heaviest human, he uses a shotgun, a rocket launcher that only holds one rocket at a time to balance it out and smoke grenade. No fists, no melee, just big damage. Vike is a sniper, with a pistol and a rabbit. Why a rabbit? Its bait. If a carnivorous (or omnivorous) dinosaur finds the rabbit, they eat, disabling them, which gives Vike time to user her sniper rifle for one dead dino. Camille is the medic of the Allies, but in Dino D-Day the medic packs are different. She throws out the pack and when her team is near the pack, they regenerate health. So she can help her team with a machine gun, luger and fists if need be. Frank is the last member of the allies, he has a machine gun, a one shot shotgun, grenades, his fists and his devilishly good looks. Over on the Axis side, you have Streicher with a gun, machine gun, stick grenade and knife. Allies use fists, sissies like the Axis use knives. Hissman is the sniper who has a luger, stick grenade and knife. He can also summon a pterodactyl to dive bomb and explode. Wolfgang is the medic of the Axis with a machine gun, luger, knife and medi-pack.Dino D-Day has undergone a major graphics change and the artwork looks fantastic. It has an art style true to the 1940s propaganda. Ole time radio broadcasts on the main menu go a long way for making an immersive experience. The game has come a long way in three years. There are more maps and better graphics, even after all this time. The game also has taken out references to Hitler and swastikas. There are now black crosses in white circles on red banners. So it still feels like Nazi swastikas, but its not. That's still okay. It doesn't hinder the fun.In case you haven't heard, the game uses the Source engine. So there are a lot of comparisons between this game and other Source games like Counter-Strike: Global Offense and Day of Defeat. It plays as easily as those games with a lot of freedom to tailor the controls to what you want them to be. A lot of the maps feel like they could be in CS:GO. They feel like deserts and small villas, all while having elements of dinosaurs in them.The Axis is the red team with blue health and the Allies are the blue team with red health. It is a bit confusing in the game. I say red and blue, because of the color of their logos. There are no actual team colors. Characters have their own non team specific attire, which can make it confusing on the battle field. How does a new player know what team that player is on? If they're on your team, they have a logo floating above their head. Anything else should get shot and killed. The problem is seeing things. A lot of times the players blend in. The night maps make it difficult to see other players, which is good for a stealth advantage. Shorter dinosaurs can hide in grass.Each of the maps has three or four modes: Deathmatch, King of the Hill, Control Points and a few maps have objectives. The objectives in those maps are pretty simple. The allies will pick up a bomb in their spawn room and set the bomb at a specific target. The bombs take a few moments to arm, then throw and then they explode after ten seconds or so. It doesn't feel like a game changer. Speaking of the spawn room, you can find unlimited health and ammo. Outside of the base, its tougher to find health. Enemies drop ammunition. Even if you're a raptor that doesn't need ammunition, by picking it up, you're denying the enemy from having it.Some maps are designed for T-rex deathmatches. These maps have the deadly giant under Axis control. A player from the Axis is randomly selected to be the tyranical beast. As T-rex you move slowly through the streets in a third person view, using a dual machine gun that needs to cool down. The T-rex can also belt out a roar that knocks the human Allies off their feet. Not your allies, I mean 'the Allies.' Once they're off their feet, you can slowly march over to them and eat them for extra health. You'll be lucky to eat someone, it doesn't happen that often. Playing as the T-rex is a lot of fun and even playing against it is a lot of fun. Sure the rex is only on the Axis team, but its balanced to the point where its so giant that all you need to do is run to a smaller area where it can't get you. Then its forced to waste time walking around buildings through giant openings to find where the action went to.In all, it might sound like a gimmick, but there is fun here. Not just the premise. The game feels balanced. There are a few ways to play to have your own fun. There are now dinosaurs on both teams so people don't flood to the Axis side saying, 'dinoz yay the new kittenz of the game world!' The developers have updated and upgraded the graphics. The Source engine is a great engine to play a first person shooter. The community is still playing the game. Give it a try again if its not your first time. It has been on sale for $1.

content:
Posted: July 1, 2014
												When you first buy the game and start playing, you might be a bit lost. Nothing seems to fit in, you can't score any kills and seems like everybody is out to get only _you_. Then you start to learn the maps, game modes, classes and the speed of games. Kill-Death ratio starts to turn, as hours spent in game pass. No dinosaur, big or small, poses a threat to you. And every dinosaur you handle, reaps through the ranks of your enemies. You run, fly and pounce through fields where bullets, grenades and goats fly. This has become your another home.And after all this, you notice that the fun hasn't disappeared even for a moment. You just continue playing and make friends in the process. Then play some more.

Posted: June 9, 2015
Novel in concept, somewhat generic in practice // Recommended for fans of Team Fortress 2 who want to shake it up a bit**Due to limited player-base, this title is recommended if on sale+ The different dinosaur classes boast unique play-styles and are a refreshingly entertaining to play+ Most playable characters have a special ability, and these are fun without being game-breaking; definitely adds to the experience, rather than takes away+ For the most part, map design is excellent and encourages competitive play; there are a couple of exceptions, but they are not enough to detract from the game+ Movement and controls are all fairly responsive and straightforward+ Healthy stock of game-modes available for online play (and bots); nothing new or innovative, but everything works well and complements the fast pace- Generally below-average visuals, character models, and textures- Questionable balance between human and dinosaur lineup, and also between factions (Allies seem to have the upper hand in firepower, but almost no dinosaurs compared to the Axis powers)- Multiplayer is not dead, but it is dwindling; one is unlikely to find more than three active servers at a timeLockeProposal's Big Day OutCommunity GroupCurator PageSerious Steam Reviews subReddit

content:
Posted: July 24, 2015
												This game is absurd, and fun to play... usually. Pitting the Allies vs the Axis in an alternate history where Germany clones dinosaurs to fuel their war effort, the Axis forces have a near monopoly on the Dinos. This doesn't mean that the Allies are any less fun to play though. Trigger, the Allies sole dino is one of the better ones, with a charge ability, and a solid machine gun to use. Playing at the Allies is more a straightforward FPS, with relatively standard classes. There is an assault, a sniper, a medic, all the regulars, and they do quite well against the dinosaurs, to the point that with a competitive team, the Axis forces have a bit of a harder time of things. Shotguns end dinos, sniper rifles end dinos from a distance. The Allies have a clear advantage on range in general. With a female french resistance medic, and a female sniper, I am also happy to see that I can play as a woman for once in an FPS. One that isn't merely relegated to a healer or noncombat class. This is pretty rare, and most people won't care, but I think it is pretty cool. Also of note is that several classes have area of effect buffs, such as accuracy or healing, allowing small squads to become even more deadly. Where the Allies have an advantage in range and teamwork, the Axis have a huge advantage in variety. Want to be fast and do melee? Try the Velociraptor, which can pounce, and generally kill people (if they are not killed during the feast animation) or the Microraptor, who can glide about the battlefield and spit poison. Want to bring in the big guns? Play as a Stygimolochs with a heavy machinegun or as a Spinosaurus, who is a miniature, low slung tank. On some maps you can even play as the legendary T-Rex.Both teams are very asymmetrical, but when dealing with new players, it seems the Allies will always get the win. Learning how to move as a dino is difficult, and many of the more powerful ones are large to the point that missing them is harder than not. My favorite thing is that the Allies are not seen as a writeoff. With some games (Pirates Vikings and Knights II comes to mind) there is a clear preference for the "cool" team, which the Axis easily could have been. Gladly this is not the case, and both teams have excellent up and downsides, encouraging you to play on both sides.

content:
Posted: October 24, 2014
												This game is fun. No matter your skill, no matter your system, no matter the class you choose. This game embodies the ultimate dream of all young boys and I can assume many young girls. WW2 mixed with Dinos I mean it's magic! I awaited this game from the moment I heard of it. It's surprising a game like this took so long to come out. But the similarity to UT is what really makes this game fun for old school gamers. Let's be honest ever since Halo and CS ruined gaming forever people have been waiting for a game that isn't realistic. If I wanted to crouch and steady myself before every shot I'd go play paintball. I want to jump and flip like a jackass while some poor sap tries to shoot the ball of rubber I've become. It's simple the matrix was cool that's what I want from a game... any game. That said the graphics are ok at best but the gameplay more than makes up for it. The only real problem I have is getting hung up on walls and corners it's sort of the one button mouse of gaming. A nearly unforgivable sin since it was fixed in most games long ago. All things considered it's a great little number I'll be playing for years to come.   -SEF

number of helpful: 27 of 30 people (90%) found this review helpful17 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 29, 2016
												A game of truly rough n' tumble skirmishes set in the second world war. Nazis alone don't make for an edgy enough plot anymore, and zombies are a garish pink vibrating strap-on of an angle that's been utterly exhausted. Despite this, it still remains on the throne, an idea selling like hot cakes much like that decayed ol' king from warhammer 40K. So, What's next on the list? Dinosaurs? Sure, why not.My first impressions are that the game plays rather nicely. Controlling dinosaurs and humans alike feels fairly fluid, though the 'runts' and humans are fixed in first person while the bigger dinosaurs take third. It would be nice to have the choice if there's variation to begin with. So You've got a mix of human and late cretatious characters to play as, and each team has a fairly unique roster to offer. Unfortunately, it's the Axis that are milking this historical re-jigging for it's worth, as they have around six or seven full dino variants to pick from. Allies only have the one, and the rest of your team is comprised of pink-♥♥♥♥♥ honkeys. This alone can sap the joy out of playing as an American, bar the fact the world hates you, but I wouldn't say it presents a significant disadvantage. I suppose there's just no satisfaction in beating on a dinosaur as a dinosaur, but rather playing Godzilla and crushing the fleeing people on a whim. This is presumably why teams are reversed each round.My main gripe with this game as it stands are the maps. They seem lackluster in design and rather sparse. Vantage points are obvious and don't really appear to be very thought out, and you can't even sling a few shells through glass windows. Overall, the game seems a tad shallow and lacking potential for interesting, engaging tactics. It's a pretty standard formula (often likened to Team Fortress 2) with nothing terribly new to offer.Nevertheless, I can't say it isn't satisfying to flatten a few yanks using a goat flung from your gargantuan jaws, or with another yank that you'd previously managed to keel over. There's fun to be had in this game for sure, but it's a quick, silly fix of entertainment and not one of any real lasting value. Would I recommend the game? Sure, for a happy drunken hootenanny or something. It's worth a chuckle or two at the least.

This is a game you play if you have ever thought "what if dinosaurs had guns strapped on them?" or "how much damage would a rocket launcher do to a T-Rex?" or "why don't more games let me shoot defenseless goats?"Hey, I like movies too but I can't watch Oscar bait highbrow stuff every night. Posted: October 15, 2016
												This game is dead,for the most part but usually gets the players it needs through sales, So i wouldnt recommend buying it when its not on sale.In short:You can run it on an old toaster.Plenty of characters to choose from.Special maps for fighting T-rex's.Balance-wise i would say this game is a 6/10Games usually tend to be won by the humans and not the dinosuars.Sometimes the smaller dinosuars can exploit the larger maps and go into downright unreachable places and The larger dinosuars often dont last long becuase they are incredibly easy to hit. Humans for the most part, are based on what you would expect, shooting and killing.Dinosuars for the most part however, rely on close-range one-shot techniques, which can cause alot of problems and is the reason matches are usually won by the humans.And There are of course, has with any team-based game, Annoying one-shot snipers on both teams (only you dont need to headshot to one-shot).I feel neutral about this game, but for the most part, its a negative.

Posted: December 26, 2016
												This is a pretty great FPS.  There isn't much reason to not like it unless you don't like the FPS genre.Pros:-All the weapons and classes are unlocked at the start (No in-game currency unlock ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t)-Classes seem balanced-Interesting classes (melee dinosaurs, dinosaurs with MG's)-Low price on sale (Only 99 cents and it goes on sale a lot)-Community is better compared to others-Doesn't take a lot to run the game-Entertaining-A couple of great jokes-Trading cards for those who want that stuff-T-Rex on some maps-You're able to change controls relatively easilyCons:-Small playerbase (You'll usually see one or two servers active)-One or two maps where players are able to get to certain rooftops where they shouldn't be-There is one map where sometimes the capture won't work and it's just endless killing-Rare bug where you aren't able to switch weapons in the classes screenNeutral:-First thing you want to do is turn off voice chat if you don't want a headache-It's an indie game-You'll see a couple of the same players around a lot-The Axis have more of a dinosaur selection while the Allies only have one-Yes, you can play as a human tooDo your friends a favor and get the 4-pack.

content:
Posted: December 7, 2015
												This game is taking place in an alternate WW2 timeline in which the Nazis have managed to resurrect the dinosaurs and are using them as the means of gaining the upper hand at the ongoing war.Now before you even attempt to immerse yourself into the epic possibilities of single player experiences this opportunity offers let me assure you that this is a multiplayer-only game (minus the SP compatible survival DLC, but that's for another review of mine) this fact howewer doesn't degrade the game's quality itself, as the multiplayer gameplay is well polished and balanced also surprisingly enough even though that playing as the dinosaurs is almost strictly a Nazi thing in this game, you won't feel the human classes being inferior compared to them. I dare to say that they are so well done compared to the dinosaurs that you won't even feel the urge to play as a dinosaur despite the fact that the chance to use dinos is available on both sides (yes, the Allies are having a singular dino type as well just for da lolz).The game is just as fun to play as a human as it is as a dino and I'm really glad that they didn't screw this up. It is truly up to the player's skills that what he/she can accomplish as I found myself exterminating everything that moved all over the place once I got the hang of a certain class, let it be a dinosaur or a human.I, being a dinosaur and Wolfenstein appreciator instantly fell in love with the sheer concept of this thing.Aaaaand pretty much that's it. It's a well balanced Multiplayer based Wolfenstein-ish dinosaur game which is absolutely worth a try if you like any of those things.Oh, did I mention that you can use goats as a physical weapon and they're instakill if you throw them at another player?This game used goats for offensive measures 3 years before Goat Simulator made it cool.

number of helpful: 21 of 25 people (84%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 4, 2016
												Your steam library is not complete until you have this game. I bought this game when it was a dollar. So be sure to get on sale or else you will spend 10$. I would pay 10 dollars if I had to. Very fun game. It's a cartoonish depiction of WWII pitting Allies, and Axis against eachother with an authentic WWII arsenal. There is a spin on the game however... The Nazis have dinosaurs at their disposal. The Nazi Dinosaur classes are hours of fun. Whether you are a goat throwing Dilophisaur, or a Dino-Snackbar self exploding compy. You will have plenty of fun with the Axis classes. I have to say the Nazi classes are my favorite in the game. The rifleman is my favorite class, but Sniper, and Medic are fun too. On some maps you can even be a T Rex! Equiped with machine guns. The Allies have only one dinosaur class, but have some fun rifleman, and machine gunner classes. I will say however that the rifleman class is extremely overpowered. (Hardgrave) and gets annoying really quick. You just have to use stealth, because the M1 Garand is extremly OP. The allies are not my favorite class, but fun none the less. The game is best known for it's online mulitplayer which is a few game modes. Ranging from Deathmatch to Capture the Flag. The DLC is okay if you have some friends, but is not as fun as the regular online multiplayer. There is my review. I highly encourage everyone to get a copy.  See you on the battlefield!600 plus hours into game, and counting.

content:
Posted: December 4, 2014
												They pretty much ruined the game with the new update (changed the version of the source engine). it has never been as unbalanced as it is now and it feels TERRIBLE to play. I got it for free, didn't expect much from it, but was quite surprised. Would have definetely paid for the old version. Not for the current one, though.Don't listen to the reviews of people that have sub 10 hours of gameplay on this game and/or bought it recently. They don't know anything about the game. It used to be completely solid and a couple tweaks away from being a very well balanced class based FPS. They basically threw it all away for a COD-like gameplay with better graphics, that is what the major update in the end of 2014 was. Everyone that buys it now gets the game because they sell it for sub 1$ dollar prices every 2 weeks and  they think "dinosaurs and guns are funn4y, i must buy this cheap game XD" and then play 2 hours and make a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ review with positive feedback and funny stupid comments, you know, the typical Steam reviews As someone who has 1800+ hours of gameplay on TF2 and 200+ hours on DDD with a couple different accounts, I really enjoy class based FPS games and DDD was for sure my favorite hipster game. Devs, please, roll back the update. Or at least allow us to play the old version too... Gifting everyone that already had the old version renaming it as "Dino D-day 2014" or something would have been a better idea.Or maybe just change the name of the game to COD: Dino D-day. Or... Call Of Dinosaurs: D-DayI will list a few of the problems with the update. I don't have the old version anymore, otherwise i would try and make a video comparison. - New branch of the source engine (same as Portal 2, i believe), which changed how the game works entirely (movemement, hitboxes, appearence). It is hard to explain exactly why and what exactly feels off, but they did a very bad job with this change. Imagine switching from CS:Source to CSGO-Undocumented change to status of weapons and health points. Now sniper rifles do A LOT more damage and can often 1 body hit kill human players (COD). Not to mention many bugs that allow you to shot extremely fast with unscoped sniper rifles, which basically allows you to use it as a shotgun and kill the T-rex and the other giant dinosaur (forgot the name, sorry) very fast.- Even more bugs with the game launcher/server browser. The game crashes a lot more often now... Principally while entering servers and switching maps. The game will go unresponsive and take several minutes to load a map and sometimes even the SERVER crashes. So yeah, when you have the luck to find a server with more than 10 people playing, eventually it will crash and people won't bother to find a new one, or spread to different servers making it impossible to find a consistently full server to play.-Changed the HUD to the top of the screen.... really? i would understand if they added an option for people that prefered it that way, but nope, they just randomly decided to force change that. Probably seems like a small thing, but it really affects the game. It is much harder to notice when you are low on health.------------------------- Default rates and interp are♥♥♥♥♥♥ as if the small dinosaurs weren't hard enough to hit. (rate 10000, cl_updaterate 20, cl_cmdrate 20, cl_interp 0.1, cl_interp_ratio 2)- No way to change the zoom sensitivity and scoped sensitivity of guns in a user friendly way, which  makes it hard for people that don't know the console commands to play the game. (scoped_sensitivity and zoom_ratio_sensitivity are the commands)-cl_fov is completely unlocked. you can easily make a script that allows you to have a sniper like zoom with any weapon.-viewmodel_fov and r_drawviewmodels locked. makes a lot of sense that they blocked these but not cl_fov... yeah.- Hardgrave is a broken class. By FAR the strongest weapon in the game, the M1 Garand clearly needs to be nerfed for this game to be playable, principally after the garbage 2014 update. It doesn't even make sense to play as any other class on the Allies, because none are as strong. The damage dealt by it and its fast firing rate make it almost like a semi-automatic kar98 (Streicher's main gun), which has a high damage for a reason, since it is so slow to fire and actually requires you to aim carefully and not just spam like a noob like the M1 garand.   - Oh yeah, and did i mention that after you get 3 kills as the hardgrave you get a "power up" that allows you to become pretty much invincible for 10ish seconds and 1 PUNCH KILL most of the classes? You can even kill the t-rex in 5 seconds with this. Completely not broken guys, cmon.

												I'm pretty sure the majority of players will hate me by saying that, but I liked it more than TF2 ...Sadly this game doesn't have a single player campaing so I would feel rather betrayed if I had bought it but I got it for free so it's ok. At least it's very fluid and there are many servers with people playing in my area so I didn't encounter any lag issues because of high ping.The gameplay itself is rather plain and I must say I like it that way.The setting and the overall feel of the game does have some funny momentum to it as the game doesn't take itself serious what makes it more enjoyable than many other games of the same genre. The sound are ok and it gets you laughing nearly every time you play. Wether this is good in a competitive online first person shooter you must decide for yourself.As this game seems to be on sale quite often I can easily recommend it to you if you are into this sort of game.I would have enjoyed it more if there weren't that damn dinosaurs in it ... but I guess then it would be another game ...For a few bucks you can get this game and have quite some fun with it. But remember: it's only online playing and there is no story mode included (heck it could have been such a great trash story with this setting ... what a lost opportunity!)@ngel

number of helpful: 14 of 16 people (88%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 2
Product received for free
												I remember the first time I played Dino D-Day. It was not long after the Christmas of 2015, or not too long after I got my Steam account. The game appeared as a reccomended game, and it seemed to combine two things I really like; Dinosaurs, and FPS games. So I gave it a go- it was free for a few days, so I figured "Why not?". When my trial was up, I went "Hell yes I'm going to buy this game! It's awesome!"... And that's how I got to where I am now, as one of the better Dino D-Day players. You'll often find me at the top of the scoreboard.I'm getting a bit more involved in Dino D-Day- To be honest, if you're a good FPS player, then this game is full of the type of people you can just pick off and destroy. Each class is different, with different strengths, weaknesses, and counters. While it's not the biggest game ever, you can usually find a few servers with at least one big server (18-24+ people), and one smaller server (2-8+ people).There's also classes that suit every playstyle. If you want a solid all-rounder, there's classes that accomodate your playstyle. If you like to pick people off from the longest sightlines, there's sniper classes that can work for you. If you want to just anhillate everything up close, then there's a lot of options for you. Even if you're a third-person shooter player, most of the dinosaurs function like that- with and without guns.To sum it all up, yes. I do reccomend Dino D-Day.  This isn't just another boring World War 2 game, some unique and interesting elements are brought here and there, and you have yourself a game that you can almost always come back to and enjoy. There are bugs here and there, but truth be told, it's only really present in the DLC, which is still fun nonetheless.Farewell, newborn player. I eagerly await your competition, or better yet, support.

number of helpful: 15 of 18 people (83%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 25, 2016
												Dino D-Day is a multiplayer game made with source where in an alternative version of World War 2 the nazis have dinosaurs on they're side so you fight as either the Allied forces or the Axis.The game is very similar to Team Fortress 2 in style of gameplay. You have multiple classes and you duke it out on the battlefield, but the biggest differences are in the dinosaurs. The soldiers are pretty much all the same with guns and explosives as they're weaponry, while the dinosaurs have multiple different abilities, from explosive rounds and flying and acid and suicide bombers.The entire game while focusing on shooting is quite stiff. It took me quite some time to actually get used to the gun play and it's not that good.From what I played I had a lot of fun, but the game is not without it's faults. The game has tons of connection issues a lot of them are not even my fault. Lag is present almost all the time, but it's not that bad that it's unplayable.The texture pop ins happen way too often and are incredibly tiresome on the eyes, because the graphics aren't that good as well. The map layouts are confusing as hell and most of the times it's confusing to just find your objective, making capture the objective maps a massive pain to play.Overall the game is fun and the community is still alive and kicking, so if you're looking for ridiculous multiplayer game check this game out.Pros:+ Fun gameplay+ DINOSAURS +Varied classes Cons:-Low resolution textures-Connection issuesFinal Rating:6.5/10

Posted: April 16, 2016
												If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding cheese cake recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients: 1 cup digestive plain sweet biscuit crumbs3 tablespoons sugar3 tablespoons melted butter40 ounces softened cream cheese1 cup sugar3 tablespoons flour1 tablespoon vanilla1 cup sour cream4 eggsDirections:For The base:.If you're using a dark pan, preheat the oven to 350. If you are using a shiny pan, 375.Combine the crumbs, melted butter and 3 tbsp sugar well and pat onto the bottom of a 9 inch springform pan. I also like to very very lightly butter the sides of the pan so that the cheesecake will not stick later on.Bake for 10 mins in your preheated oven and remove. Let it cool while you prepare your batter.For the batter:.Make sure everything is at room temperature.Combine sugar, cheese, flour and vanilla in a big bowl and mix on medium speed till well combined. Don't forget to scrape the bowl as you're doing this.Mix in the sour cream till its incorporated well. Then, add the eggs one by one, mixing well after each addition.Pour the batter into the springform and let it bake for 1 hour and 10 minutes After the baking time, turn off the oven and leave the door ajar. Let the cake cool in there for about 1 1/2 hours.Remove the cake and let it cool thoroughly. Refrigerate overnight.Release the sides of the springform.Eat.

Posted: October 8, 2015
												I adore this game. Between my studies of philosophy, and my reading of scientific journals, I make room for this excellent diversion. It is sophisticated (which fits a sophisticated, intellectual man like myself), it is intelligent (which is perfect for an intuitive mind like my own), and it has the necessary plot elements to convey the themes that the developers intended to communicate. My favourite time to play this delectable puzzle is right before my fellow gentlemen and gentlewomen come to my estate to enjoy a nice tea. It sparks great, sophisticated conversations about the inner workings of the now deceased Third Reich. Though some elements interrupt the flow of the natural history of 1940s Germany, anyone would agree that this game is an excellent, relaxing game for sophisticated individuals (like myself).I rate this 10 out of 10 stars.

content:
Posted: February 1, 2015
NOTE: I haven't bothered with the Last Stand DLC, so this is only a review for the base game.At first glance, I thought this game would be a pass. It had nothing I would typically be interested in: I rarely play MP or co-op because I find the competition/survival aspect stressful, I tend to avoid historically-based war themes (especially involving Nazis), and while dinosaurs are cool, they haven't been a draw for me since I was a kid.But as Dino D-Day was free for a weekend, I figured what the hell, I'd give it a shot. The dinos+WWII aspect was at least enough to make me curious.Lo and behold, by the end of the weekend I had sunk over 14 solid hours into the game, half in online MP matches and half messing around in SP with bots to get the hang of classes and mechanics at my own pace ("dinomon" difficulty mode is a hilarious godsend). The fact that achievements unlocked for me even though I didn't own the game yet was pretty cool too.As for my dislike for WWII themes, it was surprisingly a non-issue. While in a match the Axis/Allies thing kinda dissolves into the background and simply becomes red vs blue. It helps that they don't flaunt or overuse Nazi-related imagery or buzzwords. There's the occasional themed comment from a character after a kill, but otherwise any blatant "historical" references are primarily in the menu text and voiceovers.I really like how you can seamlessly switch classes or sides at any point (, and . keys respectively). It's not something I'd abuse if a match/team is working together really well of course, though the game sometimes auto-balances teams and swaps you unwillingly. Not really a biggie, but less fun if you get saddled with teammates who don't know what they're doing. You can always switch back when a slot opens though. :)What sold me however, was how laid back MP matches were. Not at all like your standard CS:GO/Halo-type level of stress and hair-pulling: it didn't feel like there was a competitive urgency in matches, the voice chatting I did hear was free of gratuitous cursing/whining/trash talk, and "newbie abuse" in text chat was very, very minimal. I think the absurdity of the dinosaurs is a big part of all that, honestly. It's difficult to take the game as seriously as one with a completely human cast, so "failure" becomes either amusing/inconsequential or just simply a temporary annoyance till you respawn.Parts of the game were more frustrating, but mainly the class-balancing issues, like how much of an edge Compys and Raptors have over humans based on their size and speed. Being pounced to death over and over can get annoying - especially when you know the people playing the small dinos are just using them because they're easy and OPed, and require almost zero skill to rack up kills. (Obviously that's not always the case, as good players do play small dinos, but you can tell when someone doesn't quite know what they're doing. I'm more impressed when I get sniped by someone from across the map.) Either way, it's still not even close to the amount of stress I expected.Conclusion: Dino D-Day, despite boasting themes and genre/play-styles I wouldn't normally even take a second look at, managed to enthrall me so much that I bought it. (The 90%-off sale was also a factor, but I actually did want the game.) I even considered the 4-pack, but that kind of requires that one a) has friends, and b) they would even be interested in the first place. I guess I'll stick to making friends in-game for now. :PBtw, if anyone needs a buddy for some of the trickier two-player achievements (Nigel/Microraptor, Ilona/Raptor, etc), I'll gladly assist.

Posted: August 16, 2016
												This is one of those games that definitely deserve more players.Dino D-Day is pretty cheap and it's really fun.If you don't dislike shooter and think 1€-10€ depending on offer (1€ atm 16.08.2016) is okay for a game you might play couple of times for having fun you should give it a try. If you got some friends who might play it with you it's even better since you'll have some nice players for sure, but also without friends it is fun if you join one of the few populated servers.It's allies (mainly humans, 1 dino selectable) vs axis (few humans and many dinos selectable). The Dinosaurs have unique gamestyles. 1 of them can throw goats or opponents, another one can blow itself up, then there's someone who can fly etc.Different gamemodes.Personally i bought this game for 5€ and don't feel like i wasted any cent on it. While i haven't played it that much (because this is the kind of game i usually prefer to play with friends) i had very much fun playing it.TLDR:+cheap+fun with friends+fun with random other people+unique gameplay-not many players (still enough for a few populated servers)

content:
Posted: December 16, 2013
												(TOP HALF) My experince. (BOTTOM HALF) About the game This is like COD WAW mixed with Jurasic Park.I personaly am having tooo much fun playing this. spending hours slaying britts with my Velociraptor and Desmatosuchus with a 20mm canon strapped on the back of it.I HIGHLY recommend this game if you are a fan of un-usual FPS games such as Team Fortress 2.AND as for classes there is 7 Allied customizable clases and 9 Axis customizable clases. This game IS NOT! just Dinosaurs vs Humans. Both teams can take Dino's and Human's. It is ESSENTIAL that you have a mix of both if you are wanting to win. This game in my oppinion is a 7.5/10 Fun as hell, Much differn't to i first thought. Dino D-Day is a frantic, action-packed multiplayer game that transports you to a World War II that should have been. You and your friends can battle online choosing to serve the cause of the Allied nations or the Nazis. The Allied side includes seven playable characters including Trigger, a Protoceratops rescued from the Nazis. Each Allied class has unique weapons and abilities to use in combat. Gun down a Dilophosaur with your trusty M1 Garand, blast a kamikaze pterosaur out of the sky with your Thompson sub-machine gun, or toss out a dead jackrabbit to lure a raptor into a trap.As an Axis player you will have your choice of three human classes and four dinosaur classes. Ambush your enemy with speed and stealth as the Raptor, mercilessly pound the enemy with a heavy 20mm gun as the Desmatosuchus, rampage through enemy groups as the Dilophosaur or pick up a body and throw it at an enemy for a double kill! Or if you prefer a rifle in your hand, the German soldier classes are the perfect complement to their dinosaur comrades.You’ve played World War II games before…but have you played a World War II game with dinosaurs?

content:
Posted: June 4, 2016
												So, when I bought this, I thought "Well, I can always get a refund if it sucks, which it most likely will." The reason why I bought it was for 3 reasons:1. 3 of my friends already owned the game.2. It was on sale for less than a dollar.3. Most of the reviews were positive, and the ones that weren't were spelled wrong and didn't give me any reason to take their opinions into my decision process (aka they were incredibly stupid)But when I played it, it wasn't that bad. Sure, there are assets and sounds used from other games (ie. TF2), but the game was pretty fun! Raptors were like playing as Hunters in L4D and L4D2, Trigger handled pretty well, and the armored dino was like playing as a tank! Only smaller and more mobility. All in all, give it a shot. People say it's hard, but as long as you are the type that doesn't play all that seriously or just generally not a tryhard rager, it's pretty fun.

 About Dino D-DayIf there were dinosaurs, Dino D-Day would be one of many online shooter on the Second World War. While there are dinosaurs and developers recognizing the genius of their idea and intelligent humor with which it is carried out, however, the game is one of many online shooter. The different classes can be interesting for a while 'and the maps are moderately interesting, at least until you get bored, because they are quite small and in a couple of games they already know all the secrets. Twenty euro these days are not a no brainer, but it bodes well that you get the single player and already there is talk of new maps and additional dinosaurs. Of course, when these things will come it remains a mystery. Until then we are in front a game that can entertain but which will soon be shelved, at least until the new additions promises. In short, what the shooter is a market ultra inflated and there is a lot better for a lot less.Release Date: 9 Apr, 2011All in All  Dino D-Day is a very nice Action Game!9/10 From MeSweep

number of helpful: 16 of 27 people (59%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 29
												I started playing this game today thinking what do i have to lose, i paid less than a dollar for the game and love dinosaurs so how bad could it be right? WRONG!This game has a ton of servers up however 95 percent of them have no players on them. But to be honest there were about four servers with players on them so even though it's quiet it still has some people playing it.  The game starts out having you pick between Axis and Allies, i thought to myself okay this is standard in WWII shooters, what's next? So i picked allies as i hate being on axis in games for obvious reasons. I then progressed through all the different gun classes available which is 3-4 different characters per side. Even though their aren't many guns to choose from that's not the problem, the problem is that the gunplay is far below even subpar. The hit detection is broken in the sense that you will not get kills from headshots but rather by firing in a direction that you think the enemy will be going because the animations are so broken you will never get a clean kill unless a player is standing still or is afk.  I can't tell you how many times i shot players directly in the face only to watch them run off like a headless chicken with downsyndrome.Playing as the dinosaur classes is even more problematic and laughable, the animations are terrible, the characters are over powered and it feels broken beyond repair. I won't go into detail but to say the classes are unbalanced is an understatement.The graphics are also horrible even in 4k. This would be acceptable, as i realize the game is getting on the older side for shooters but even the lighting effects are dispicable. Enoujgh said it's hard to make out what's going on in the game even on 4k settings on ultra...The main menu is the best part of this game  because of the music and radio voiceovers. But even the main menu can't save this game as it allows you to customize controls but sadly the controller support does not work even though the game says it does....The in game sounds are also horrendous and gave me a headache after less than three hours of gameplay.. I could go on about this game but do i really have to as i said i got this game for under a dollar and am still staring at my monitor wondering why i wasted the money and time.1.5 out of 10 for those of you that like a score next to a game. I would rather jump into a bed of cactus face first then ever play this P.O.S again. Happy Gaming :D

content:
Posted: January 20, 2016
												~Long-ish Dino D-Day Review~Summary: Dino D-Day is a 1st/3rd Person Shooter with a relatively small player base. Do not let this fool you, though. The game itself is actually quite fun. The game is akin to the play style of TF2 and CS:GO. It offers a few different gamemodes as well as a nice array of characters to choose from (everywhere from run-n-gunners to snipers and...DINOSAURS). The best thing this game has to offer is its raw concept, dinosaurs in WW2. Let me tell you, that stays enjoyable.Ignore the Critics: The game does have poor reviews from Metacritic and a few notably bad reviews on Steam. Don't let this deter you. These reviews were written a LONG time ago and the game has since fixed (not all but) most of the bugs that ruined gameplay. Should You Buy?: Personally picked up the 4-pack at $3.00 coming out to 75 cents per copy (90% off). This is a more than acceptable price for the game. I would highly recommend the 4-pack when the game is on sale. Playing with friends is a blast and the DLC (Last Stand) is decent if you have some buds to play with. The DLC is definitely not necessary for you to enjoy the game.Quick Pros:-Playing as a dinosaur in WW2 is just as fun as it sounds.-Really good deal when it's on sale (90% off).Quick Cons:-Small online community.-Couple bugs here and there.All in All:8.1/10 Would Recommend (on sale...)

content:
Posted: March 17
												A fun source based multiplayer game.... WITH DINOSAURS!!!I had a lot of fun with this game and definitely recommend it but there are not that many people playing as of the date of this review, generally there are two or three servers with people playing. There is also an option to create your own match with bots if that is of any interest.You have the choice of soldiers and a dino when playing as allies and then mainly dino's when playing as axis. Each class has their own weapons and special abilities such as air strikes and a dino with ability to throw a goat and kill the enemy in one hit. There are a couple of different game modes including KOTH, capture the point and deathmatch. There are other games modes but they are rarely played.Just in case all of that didn't persuade you; yes you can be a t-rex.With all that in mind, I personally would not pay full price at the moment purely due to low number of players online, I believe I picked mine up on sale at Christmas or another one of steams mass sales for next to nothing. If you can get this on sale, you will not be disappointed even if it's just to setup a bot match and try to defend yourself from a horde of micro-raptors with a flamethrower.

content:
Posted: December 14, 2013
												A game of truly rough n' tumble skirmishes set in the second world war. Nazis alone don't make for an edgy enough plot anymore, and zombies are a garish pink vibrating strap-on of an angle that's been utterly exhausted. Despite this, it still remains on the throne, an idea selling like hot cakes much like that decayed ol' king from warhammer 40K. So, What's next on the list? Dinosaurs? Sure, why not.    My first impressions are that the game plays rather nicely. Controlling dinosaurs and humans alike  feels fairly fluid, though the 'runts' and humans are fixed in first person while the bigger dinosaurs take third. It would be nice to have the choice if there's variation to begin with. So You've got a mix of human and late cretatious characters to play as, and each team has a fairly unique roster to offer. Unfortunately, it's the Axis that are milking this historical re-jigging for it's worth, as they have around six or seven full dino variants to pick from. Allies only have the one, and the rest of your team is comprised of pink♥♥♥♥♥♥♥honkeys. This alone can sap the joy out of playing as an American, bar the fact the world hates you, but I wouldn't say it presents a significant disadvantage. I suppose there's just no satisfaction in beating on a dinosaur as a dinosaur, but rather playing Godzilla and crushing the fleeing people on a whim. This is presumably why teams are reversed each round.    My main gripe with this game as it stands are the maps. They seem lackluster in design and rather sparse. Vantage points are obvious and don't really appear to be very thought out, and you can't even sling a few shells through glass windows. Overall, the game seems a tad shallow and lacking potential for interesting, engaging tactics. It's a pretty standard formula (often likened to Team Fortress 2) with nothing terribly new to offer.Nevertheless, I can't say it isn't satisfying to flatten a few yanks using a goat flung from your gargantuan jaws, or with another yank that you'd previously managed to keel over. There's fun to be had in this game for sure, but it's a quick, silly fix of entertainment and not one of any real lasting value. Would I recommend the game? Sure, for a happy drunken hootenanny or something. It's worth a chuckle or two at the least.

content:
Posted: July 9, 2014
												Very fun game, but obviously has some downsides which are just part of the game. It's hard to hit the tiny dinosaurs, but this is offset by the flamethrower. It is still possible to kill with the Garand or automatic weapons if you aim properly. Tiny dinos aren't that good anyway.I find it odd that there is no kick to guns if you aim down the sights, but this is offset by how much it obscures the screen.Most other negative reviews for this game are just rabbling about the hitboxes and how the game works. Axis and allies aren't actually unbalanced, and teams are auto-balanced so there is an equal amount of players on each time. Usually, the game is unbalanced in that good players really stick out.This game is more-or-less Day of Defeat Source but with Dinosaurs. Try the game, it's good. Definitely worth money.

content:
Posted: March 6, 2015
												I didn't know nazis had dinos...thx 4 history lesson devs 10/10------------------------------All jokes aside though, This is sort of a interesting fun thing to pick-up for a cheap price, It's basically a fictional WW2 scenario where the Axis have Dinos hence the name "Dino D-Day" (?)It's multiplayer only and you get to pick a team, then pick a class and so forth.Then it plays out as a normal TDM/CTF like most multiplayer games.What made me recommend it because it felt different as in some maps the Axis can have a T-Rex fight alongside them which changes the game abit.There's some mounted guns around some maps that sorta help out if used in the right angle...Not exactly different from the rest but something.Another thing is most classes (except the T-Rex) have REALLY little amount of health but still do-able which made it feel balanced and in a weird way entertaining.That's pretty much it, just the little things you'll get bored of it really early on but still unique in a way i guess.Oh I forgot to mention that the Allies also have Dinos but not alot (only 2 classes) while the Axis have about 6-7 (Which still doesn't make the Axis OP, some weapons on the Allies's side are really powerful.)

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 5, 2014
												This game, Fits my catagory as fun. The insane plot, and the humor to go with it, makes it worth buying. If you like TF2, You will like this game, the humor from that game, can be found in this one, but it's still a different kind of humor. What I mean is that, It's not directly copy and paste. But that alone, should make someone want to play it. But, No, The gameplay is great as well. First off, This is a multiplayer game. No single player. HOWEVER, there is an option to face bots, if you want to play singleplayer, And you can customize the bots freely, Such as the difficulty, and What class they spawn as, But the fun can be found in the multiplayer in my opinion. I just like the fact they added the bots. You play as 1 of 2 teams. Allies, or Axis. The two powers in World War II. And each has some unique classes, Of course, You have your standard soldiers, for standard FPS gameplay, But they can be limited in what they do. Some are more close combat oriented, and others prefer long range. And you are stuck with the weapons they spawn with, you cannot pick up others. I like that idea. Of course, The most unique aspect of the game, Is the Dinosaurs. They are fun to play as... Extremely fun... At least for me. Others might have fun killing them, i like playing as them. The dinos in this game, Can also be unique in class. None feel the same. And some are harder to play than others. Also, Taking a dino, And strapping a gun to it's back... Is just awesome. Teamwork is rewarded in this. Going off alone and not helping the team, will almost always result in death. Sometimes, it can be worth it. But most of the time, helping team mates goes a long way. It almost feels like a comedic Battle field game, with smaller maps and such.  And while we are on the maps, They are all unique, and enjoyable. None of them make me say "Aw... this map again?" I always had a smile towards the next game. So, I recommend this game. The fact that nobody requested this, and the Devs put effort in this, makes it a very enjoyable game.

content:
Posted: July 2, 2014
												I bought this game looking especially the price, less than 2.5 euro ... thinking that even if it was crap, the economic loss would be completely irrelevant! Well, after a few hours of play I can be said to be more than satisfied with my choice: let's be clear, is anything but a masterpiece, but manages to give an immediate and enjoyable gaming experience. It's far from the technical levels of the most modern shooters, but it reminds me those games of late '90s that I loved to play cause they were able to enjoy immediately and give a couple of enjoyable hours, especially sharing them with friends. Again, the game has a pretty old graphics, mechanics  little outdated, and many people (especially younger players) may not like it, but in my opinion it's a must (at this price) for people like me who loved the first-person shooter in their beginning, because Dino D Day is this, a dip into the past. PRO: + concept + dinosaurs + class system + immediate gameplay (+ old mechanics) CONS:: -graphics -no interaction with the environment -some weapons are really OP (...flamethrower ) -some minor bugs (-old mechanics)ITALIANO:Ho comprato questo gioco guardando soprattutto il prezzo, meno di 2,5 euro...pensando che se anche fosse stato una schifezza, la perdita economica sarebbe stata del tutto irrilevante!ebbene, dopo un paio di ore di gioco io posso dire di essere più che soddisfatto della scelta fatta: parliamo chiaro, è tutto fuorchè un capolavoro, ma riesce a dare un'esperienza di gioco immediata e piacevole.Lontano dai livelli tecnici dei più moderni sparatutto, mi ricorda però quei giochi fine anni '90 che tanto mi piaceva giocare poichè capaci di divertire immediatamente e regalare un paio di ore spensierate, specialmente condividendo l'esperienza con gli amici.Ripeto, il gioco ha una grafica piuttosto vecchia, meccaniche superate e a molti (specialmente i più giovani giocatori) potrà non piacere, ma a mia opinione è un must (a questo costo) per chi come me hanno amato gli sparatutto in prima persona ai loro albori, perchè Dino D Day è questo, un tuffo nel passato.PRO:+concept+dinosauri+sistema a classi+gameplay immediato(+vecchie meccaniche)CONTRO:-grafica -nessuna interazione con l'ambiente-alcune armi OP (...lanciafiamme)-alcuni bug minori(-vecchie meccaniche)NB:Mi trovate su YouTube, Raziel's Channel all'indirizzo https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC8mjStAGRGo-5SV9K205NBw

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 8, 2016
												Remember when you were a little kid and you had army men, often engaging in crazy battles between transformers, Batman, and even dinosaurs? Those timeless days spent by yourself, picking up tiny pieces of plastic and following along with insane campaigns of your own demented design?That's sort of what it's like playing Dino D-Day. You might be spraying tiny carnivores with your tommy gun one second, and the next, you'll be ragdolled against a wall, instantly slain by a flying goat. Or you might be courageously defending an ally with your trusty M1 Garand, clips flinging out of your weapon hither and thither, when suddenly you hear a mighty roar behind you, and you are mowed down by the twin chain guns of the Tyrannosaurus Rex. These things have happened to me and will assuredly happen to you.The game is just great, goofy fun. You'll never feel TOO mad losing in this game, because there's always something dopey to laugh at. Even the loading screens, which are for my taste, a bit long, are still dominated by silly wartime documents detailing the Nazi war machine with their new reptillian additions. I am particularly fond of the newspaper article concerning a dino rendition of a grand Wagnerian opera that goes horribly wrong.In terms of gameplay, the multiplayer is indeed frantic, and requires you to do some thinking. If you choose the wrong class for your situation/map, then that could spell doom for your team. Alternatively, a well-placed tank dino might be just what you need to hold the point long enough. And although not many people necessarily play games with that much thought, I am confident that the construction of the class system is actually well-balanced and caters to any play style.Going back to that previous point, some may argue that certain classes are too powerful. To that I say, "phooey!" Each class has a counter-class, and the sooner you realize this, the better you'll play. As the most specific example, I've heard many people complain about the Allied character with the Garand. Yeah, he's pretty strong, especially in the hands of an expert marksman. But you put him in front of a tank dino and he's toast. Really. My point: if you're sucking, it's your own freakin' fault.If you don't have the DLC (and I don't, although I'm going to pick it up soon), there are three basic match types: deathmatch, king of the hill, and demolition. The T-Rex spawns on a couple maps, and adds a whole new dynamic to the gameplay. The maps are also well-made and don't allow players to hide anywhere indefinitely, save for the flying raptor, who often needs that upper hand/deception to stalk and make great kills.Anyway, if you're on the fence, I am all about this game. It's really excellent, and incredibly rewarding to people who play it either casually or otherwise. The only downside is that there is not a huge amount of people playing at the moment, which is really a shame, because this game rocks. I am looking forward to what other games the developers make.Go on, you know you want to throw a goat.

												Dino D-Day easily captures attention by mixing Nazis and dinosaurs into an online World War II shooter but doesn't stay interesting for long. The guns don't feel powerful and the Nazi dinosaur combatants, despite all the humor value they bring to a fight, bring little in the way of satisfying gameplay. Sloppy controls, class imbalances, mediocre maps and a general lack of polish make Dino D-Day a tough game to enjoy. Once it's done making you laugh, there isn't much else worth sticking around for.

content:
Posted: November 26, 2016
												Dino D-Day easily captures attention by mixing Nazis and dinosaurs into an online World War II shooter but doesn't stay interesting for long. The guns don't feel powerful and the Nazi dinosaur combatants, despite all the humor value they bring to a fight, bring little in the way of satisfying gameplay. Sloppy controls, class imbalances, mediocre maps and a general lack of polish make Dino D-Day a tough game to enjoy. Once it's done making you laugh, there isn't much else worth sticking around for.

												How can I describe Dino D-Day? It's kind of like Day of Defeat with dinosaur's, and more weapons, and you have alternet weapons to choose from. Dino D-Day is the most underrated game I have even played. I have had more fun in Dino D-Day then most other games. Sure the game is in the Source engine, but that's ok, dated grachic's don't make a bad game. The only problem I have with Dino D-day is that there are not that many people playing it, other then when it's got a free weekend. I hope People pick it up more and play it. It's way better then most multi-player games out there. It's one of the few good dinosaur games out there, and the consept is great! Please pick this game up, you'll have a great time!

content:
Posted: July 2, 2016
												Dino D-Day is a game with 2 teams Allies (mainly a human team with only one dinosaur named trigger) and Axis (mainly a dino team with only 3 humans) the 4 game modes are TDM, T-Rex mode, Capture The Flag, and King of the Hill. TDM is allies vs axis, T-Rex mode is when they choose one person from axis to be a rex, King of the Hill is when you try to capture the flag for the team and wait for the time to run out, and Capture the Flag is when you capture 5 flag points and one point requires 2 or more people to capture it. This game is really fun and i recomend it, its worth the money and time to play it. Anyways if you ever get the game i hope yall enjoy playing it!

												I never really enjoyed first-person shooter games, because they normally give me headaches, but this game may be one of the only exceptions! With a steady hand on your mouse and a good connection to the internet, the headaches cease to torture me. I find the game light-hearted and fun. I mean, how can you take a game where you play as/with/against (nazi) dinosaurs seriously? It's funny and enjoyable. There aren't many people playing online, but when you find a decently filled server, it is fun to play. I highly recommend this game to those who are in it for fun rather than to beat the rest of the players.

content:
Posted: February 19, 2015
OverviewYou can't get more rediculous than Nazi Dinosaurs. Dino D Day is a funny little indie game that puts you in online multiplayer fights between humans and dinosaurs, axis vs allies. There are dinosaurs and humans for both sides however - unlike primal carnage and extinction. This also means you get less annoying people going AFK so they can switch teams. But anyway, this game is pretty fun and has an amusing story shown through news clippings on loading screens. However everything does a little too much damage, so whatever you are you die pretty quickly. This does get a little annoying...Positive+ Dinosaurs+ Team Variety+ Lots of game modesNegative- GraphicsConclusionDino D Day is interesting and fun enough but can get very frustrating as everyone dies so quickly, so a lot of your time will just be spent waiting for the respawn screen. Also, there are bots in the game.

Posted: March 17, 2016
												This game takes place in the era of WW II, Hitler and his scients have found a way to make Dinosuars. Thus the concept of Dino D-Day. Battlefields of team deathmatch against the SS and their dinosuars vs the US troops and its dinosaur. (Notice i didnt had an S at the end of dinosaur?? Well thats because the US only gets one ["Everybody gets one."] ) This game is extremly fun and i absolutly recomend this game. (hints the thumbs up, and why this is sectioned under the positvie section of the review catagory)  This game does have a low amount of people playing, infact you generally find your playing with the same group of people. While this game as a low user plaer base, it doesn't stop it from being extremly fun. Its actually a shock at how low the user player base is. Thats why im writing this review, to get YOU. Yes i do mean YOU to come play this game. come be apart of the DDD comunity and come kill some Nazi Dinosuars!!!...... or kill Americans, you know your call. What are you waiting for? Why are you still reading this? Go buy this game! Seriously stop reading this review, come join this community and this amazing adventure youll have playing this game.

content:
Posted: January 8, 2016
												Dino D-Day is a multiplayer team-based first-person action video game developed by 800 North and Digital Ranch and published by Valve Corporation. It was released as a digital download, via Steam, on April 8th 2011.The game is developed as a total conversion modification on the Valve Corporation's Source engine.The premise of the game is that during World War II, Adolf Hitler found a way to resurrect dinosaurs for use in the war effort. Players can battle online choosing to serve either the Allied nations or the Nazis.The game has been described as a new twist on "the overdone World War II FPS ... that has become a running joke in the industry and gaming press". Upon the game's initial release, both the Allies and the Axis had six different classes of soldier. The Allied classes range from assault troops, medics and heavy support. However, the Axis have three human and three dinosaur classes. The human classes comprise assault troops, snipers and medics; while the dinosaurs comprise an attack Velociraptor, Dilophosaurus, and a Desmatosuchus with a cannon mounted on its back. Additional classes were added to both teams at later dates bringing the total to seven classes for the Allies and nine for the Axis. The Allies gained a dinosaur class of their own, a Protoceratops with a mounted machine gun. The Axis gained a Stygimoloch with a mounted gun, a Compsognathus that acts as a kamikaze bomber with a grenade and a flying Microraptor. In certain maps, an Axis player can also be chosen at random to play as a Tyrannosaurus with a jaw-mounted machine gun. While powerful, the class counts as three kills in a team death match.

content:
Posted: June 3, 2016
THAT IS MY DINO.Dino D-Day is a simple and fun multi-player FPS. The game is set in a WW2 setting where dinos are a thing and both Axis and Allies have some of them. This is it. You pick a server, chose your class and play it. After some time, you'll be given the chance to play as a big dinosaur and make lots of kills (or be just an idiot dino and wander around the map). However, at least without the DLC Last Stand, I couldn't find lots of servers, but I had some fun with it in some of the official servers. And it's obviously unbalanced.I also experienced some performance issues and long loading times, both unexpected, especially the loading time (in my first play it takes 1 minute to load the map/server, then 30 seconds on the next plays).Anyway, I really recommend it for it's price.This is a 8.0/10 for me.

												5.3/10 - Dinosaurs and Nazis Mixed with Counter StrikeIt’s a pretty fun game, not the best by any means. For the price I would pick up CS:GO or something with more polish. I have to say though killing and Nazis and Dinosaurs can never be that bad!I've found its way easier to play as the dinosaurs/Nazis. Some of the dinos are too small and prove impossible to kill with your gun alone. (Being one is way fun.) You will do more dying in this game than many others. For that reason I can't give it too high of marks. Multiplayer still has a few servers rocking; these players for the most part have played lots and will crush you at first. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 22, 2014
												This is an excellent game. Even though Dino D-Day isn't that popular, the game has some good and bad thigs things about it. First of all, the different classes are very creative and fun, especially in the Axis. You can control a variety of different dinosaurs like the velociraptor and the compsognathus. The velociraptor can leap on people and will kill the oppenent and kill them if someone can't shoot it off in time. The compy (Compsognathus) will go and take out peole. If they get 3 kills, they can run at the enemy and explode with devastating power. Those are just a few of the creative dinos and what they do. The Allied classes are pretty cool too, though I thought the Allies could have had one or two more classes, but that's just nitpicking. There are some great map designs, (Other then T-rex maps, talk more into detail later.) I still haven't found all of the good sniper spots yet. The only bad things I can think of are the graphics, and the ultimate kicking-butt-and-taking-names-dinosaur, the T-rex. The graphics are meh, but can be easily overlooked after a few rounds. The T-rex, though incredibly awesome, isn't that great in game. At times he seems overpowered, but at other times he seems too weak. I think it's mostly because of the design of the maps with the T-rex. In one map there is a huge open expanse where there will either: A. Get slaughtered by snipers, the machineguns, snipers, etc. or B. Get to their base and slaughter them. It doesn't bother me much because I play the maps without T-rex, so I can't comlain much. The only other thing wrong is how unpopular this game is. When the servers start to empty out, there can sometimes be only 5 people total on one of the many servers there are. Like most other games, it's only fun when there are lots of other people. So I recommend you get this game and fill up the servers.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 10, 2014
												I hadn't played a first person shooter type game since 2009, so I was a bit skeptical about picking this game up. However, I have thoroughly enjoyed this game. There are strengths and weaknesses in both groups which helps balance everything out. The levels are pretty fun and inventive and smooth to play through (though sometimes the Dinos get stuck on objects... especially the big ones!). The graphics are also very nice, and the little details that they put into the Character models are pretty cool too... the T-Rex's belly jiggles when she moves! All in all, I am very happy to have bought this game and have a lot of fun playing whether I win or lose. But... remember that this is all coming from someone who hasn't played a shooter game since 2009. So I can't compare it to other games and have no other shooter gaming experience.As with most online shooters, your experience will vary depending on whomever is on the server at any given game. Sometimes you do well, sometimes you don't. Just keep that in mind! ^^

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 20, 2013
												I played the game for a bit on a free weekend I while I thought it was a novel experience, the user interface is complete♥♥♥♥♥ This game cries out for an interactive run down of the controls. It was a constant annoyance having to back out to the Controls sub-menu ever 2-3 minutes to troubleshoot some queuery of 'how do I do that thing'. Also, the Axis teams seem to be disproportionately occupied, making getting to actually play as a dinosaur almost impossible with the constant auto-balancing. Out of 7-8 matches in which I STARTED as Axis I was abruptly auto-balanced over to Alliance, something I found supremely obnoxious. But at the end of the day 100% of the playability comes from playing as/shooting up Nazi Dinosaurs. And if playing as/pumping lead into a Nazi Dinosaur is your dream the learning curve shouldn't dissuade you from flailing around, frantically nipping the ankles of Ally scum/blowing the head off a mother-chompin' T-Rex.
