content:
Posted: July 2, 2014
												15/10Game of the Decade.I was lucky enough to pick this game up for free, so I am slighty biased, as I didn't have to spend a dime on it. However, I would happily pay for this game.As a kid, I am sure you would often play with your dinosaur toys and your army-men action figures. You probably had some crazy scenario where the bad guys controlled the dinos and the good guys were the army men trying to stop the bad guys.This is that game.This is the awnser to a question I never knew I had, and that question is "What would I call the Peak of humanity?"Brilliant gameplay, great ingame chatter between the NPCs, and amazing matches.I never knew I wanted to be a 25 foot T-Rex with Gattling guns strapped to the side of my head before today.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 6, 2014
												Dino D-Day is a fresh breath in the unfortunately stale age of Call of Duty. Like all games it has it's pro's and cons, but I feel the pros far out way the cons. The community is friendly and the game is simply entertaining. Over all I give the game 7.5/10The Pros:The community is friendly. The game's loading screens let and trailers let you know the game doesn't take itself seriously and the community seems to reflect the "It's just for fun" attitude. Newbie’s are always asking for help and the Vets are off to the rescue with quick replies.The Dino-factor.Adding in a handful of random dinosaurs with machine gun attached to their head makes it fun to play other characters for a change instead of the running shotgun or the always camping sniper, although those characters are open if that’s your style.The game offers a multiple maps and game play options.This is often taken for granted, “it's an online multiplayer game, of course it is going to have options!” Yes, but these add a certain flavor to each game and game play.The Cons:There is no tutorial and the manual is not always helpful. The game gives you some hints on the loading screens, but more often than not the Newbie’s, like myself, have had to take a break from chowing down on an Allied soldier or shooting dino's to ask for some help.The maps are often cluttered.It makes for great fun on some places but other maps just feel like they were thrown together quickly so that there was an extra map. One map even has two towers that allow you to spawn camp rather easily.The graphics aren't too modern.This one isn't a large concern of mine, I remember Goldeneye, still have it in my N64 and this is a large step away from the age of Doom. Still, I understand why some people could be put off by the raw graphic.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2015
												It's always great to see the looks on my friends faces when I tell them I'm going home to play "Dino D-Day". Dino D-Day is a multiplayer game that throws dinosaurs into an otherwise mediocre FPS. It's really a novelty more than anything and a great game to pick up for on sale, but play it for no more than 15 minutes and you'll quickly realize it's nothing more than an unoriginal cardboard cutout design of the ever popular TF2, taking similar systems, sounds and maps Dino D-Day still reamins playable thanks to its lovable gimmick. I mean who doesn't love cannon mounted dinosaurs? A decent and playable 6/10

content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
												Well, it seems games evolve with updates, so never tried dino d day in its early days, but people said it was bad. After 3 years of being released, I got it and all the bugs and glitches have been fixed. Didn't find any bug like animals floating etc. Regarding to gameplay, now it is more balanced, since you can go dino + soldiers (axis) vs dino + soldiers (allies). Before, only nazis had dinos. Although it could be named as a mod, dino d day is a very fun game, very arcade so don't compared it to COD or BF3/4.The animations of dinos are ok, the weapons are ok, and graphics, well, it is made in source engine (2004), so kind of meh.  But when deathmatching and combined with parade music of world war, it makes the game ridiculous in a good way. To kill some time is recommended. I wish it had more maps and game modes, the game offers little. So, buy it only on discount (50% off 0r 75% off)P.D I enjoyed more dino d day than titan fall and COD ghost.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 16, 2014
												I'd say this game is just a Call of Duty clone with dinosaurs, but it is actually quite different. Instead, it plays a lot like Team Fortress 2 (most likely because it runs off of what looks like the Source engine). The game doesn't fling you into a chincey "First person shooter...but with DINOSAURS!!!!11!!11!" mentality because the game is actually well balanced, with even the Tyrannosaurus Rex being well balanced. It features plenty of playable reptilian friends along with those of the homosapian nature, and neither class is overpowered. A definite buy (especially at it's 90% off sale at .99 cents)!PROS:Play as different dinosaurs that aren't gimmickyWell balanced game overallPretty good map designAudio is cleanDoesn't feel repititious like CoD or Battlefield because of the Dinosaur mechanic and their strengths and weaknessesDefinitely asking a good price for the gameCONS (with opinions):Game engine could've been better, something that doesn't feel too Valve-y, could've utilized higher detail engines (Unreal would've been perfect in my opinion).Even with the selection of Dinosaurs, more would've definitely been better.The wait to respawn mechanic gets old. Fast.Switching class in spawn kills you (and restarts the respawn timer).Other than that, the game is pretty good.IS IT WORTH YOUR TIME AND $$$ - YESWILL IT SATISFY YOUR DINO FPS HUNGER - YESIS THE GAME REALLY FUN AND FRESH FEELING - YESWILL THE GAME MAKE YOU RAGE - PROBABLY AT TIMESDO I DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS GAME - YOU BETCHA!Gameplay 9.5/10

content:
Posted: December 20, 2013
												I played the game for a bit on a free weekend I while I thought it was a novel experience, the user interface is complete♥♥♥♥♥ This game cries out for an interactive run down of the controls. It was a constant annoyance having to back out to the Controls sub-menu ever 2-3 minutes to troubleshoot some queuery of 'how do I do that thing'. Also, the Axis teams seem to be disproportionately occupied, making getting to actually play as a dinosaur almost impossible with the constant auto-balancing. Out of 7-8 matches in which I STARTED as Axis I was abruptly auto-balanced over to Alliance, something I found supremely obnoxious. But at the end of the day 100% of the playability comes from playing as/shooting up Nazi Dinosaurs. And if playing as/pumping lead into a Nazi Dinosaur is your dream the learning curve shouldn't dissuade you from flailing around, frantically nipping the ankles of Ally scum/blowing the head off a mother-chompin' T-Rex.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 9
												It’s like Counterstrike with dinosaurs, DINOSAURS WHICH ARE NAZIS! It's pretty safe to say Dino D-Day is a different kind of World War II shooter, mostly because it features dinosaurs. This game has some kind of sarcastic humor and trys to show the people the worldwar-topic on a funny not serious way. Like WTF THE NAZIS ARE SO OVERPOWERED and have MAGICALLY POWER…!!! HAVE YOU HEARED THEY RESURRECTED THE DINOSAURS FOR A NOT STOPABLE DINOSAUR ARMY? Ehm… yes thats the game about. xDGenre: Multiplayer, first person shooterGraphic: 9/10 good graphic with funny detailsAudio: 10/10 realistic sound, historical soundTeams: Allied nations and NazisCharacters: 9 different humans, 7 dinosaur classes All with special abilities and weapons (26 classical weapons from WWII). Gameplay: 8/10 for the controls; primary it’s a bit confusing but when you are better with the controls and you have a better overview about the map ist pretty funny.Cons:I don’t know why but some controls don’t work for me: For example I looked for the keyboard controls and it said „F = weapon option“ but with a human nothing happens when I press F and when I press F with a dinosaur he pees. O: Really…. He pees!And the R for reload also doesn’t work for me… I have just played it for 2 hours but it’s still a bit confusing for me (so I would be really happy if someone of you can help me out ^^).An other negative aspect in my eyes that there are just a few people playing this game so there are a lot of server with no players and you don’t have much choice on which server you want to play. It’s also sad that there is just ONE Server with BOTS and I asked myself if this server is in china or where because first time I couldn’t connect and the second time I waited for 5 minutes till I connected with 900+ Ping and frozen pictures / teleport (you maybe know this feeling).However I still think its a good game because I was 2 hours on a good working server with uhm around 20-30 players the whole time and I had a lot of fun. You should make your own opinion from the facts but if you play it please let me know! (:

content:
Posted: January 30, 2015
												Really fun game that I got for free over the summer thanks to PC Gamer.  You get to play as one of two sides, the Allies or the Axis.  When you're the Allies, you will play as soldiers, though there is one dino available to play as.  The fun part of the game is when you play as the Axis, since that is where most of the playable dino characters are available.  My favourite dinosaur is the small flying one, and you get to rekt snipers since they never pay attention to their surroundings.  If you like class based shooters, then you'll probably like this game .  If not, then maybe you'll like the dinosaur gameplay.ALSO:  They recently updated the game, bringing it to a newer verison of the Source engine from what I know.  There is also a new DLC called Last Stand which is just survival, seems cool but I haven't gotten it yet.

content:
Posted: December 24, 2011
												A legitimently interesting FPS. A class-based multiplayer shooter set in an alternate version of World War II. One where the Nazis ressurected dinosaurs to fight in an army. You can play as the dinosaurs. The Axis has 3 human classes and 6 dinosaurs, whereas the Allies have 8 humans and one dinosaur. The Allies are also from different backgrounds which makes them feel like actual characters.In Short: The maps are interesting (In one the Allies can collect presents that Santa dropped after he was shot down), the mechanics are cool, and the game is very fun.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 27, 2011
												This game is fun.  Now, when I say "fun," I mean that it is FUN.  Pure, unadultered FUN.  It's the sort of game where you can play as an exploding compsognathus, which should say enough.  Of course, there are some people out there who want realistic, serious games.  People who get offended because someone else's dinosaur does not match what they pictured as said dinosaur.  This game is very tongue-and-cheek about everything it does.  It's a war game with dinosaurs, and it knows it.  It's a beautiful sense of humor that also makes this game a winner.  As well as the community; it's a small, friendly group of people who will help you out if you're a beginner.  In short, if you have a sense of humor and a love of dinosaurs, then this is the game for you.

content:
Posted: March 7, 2016
												This one's a decent buy but just barely in my opinion. You can get it on sale for $1 and it is entertaining but I don't feel it's something that can be played for a very long time. May be wrong about that though.Pros:Only $1 on saleFunnyThey have a tiny dinosaur that has a stick grenade taped to it's back to suicide bomb. That falls under funny but it deserves it's own.Cons:Most servers seem empty, only like 3-4 populated ones.My ping will randomly jump from ~40 to over 800, it did this in every server and turned the game into a slideshow making me a free target for the other team.The axis gets most of the dinosaurs and the allies only get one. This wouldn't be too terrible if 2 of the axis dinosaurs weren't microscopic and a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥to shoot.The teams aren't exactly mirror copies, obviously because axis gets the most dinosaurs you'd expect that. The allies have a flamethrower which the axis has no similar class for, meanwhile the axis raptor is close to an assassin since you can pounce people for a near instant kill. The most annoying part is that the classes that do exist on both sides aren't necessarily lined up. Both teams have snipers and medics for example but when your team switches you'll be something else because they're not in the same location on the selection screen.So-So:The graphics aren't the best but that's to be expected.Some of the gun animations look like crap to me.A bit odd is that some dinosaurs are 3rd person and others are 1st person.Community, I put this hear because I couldn't get a read on them. Some of the chat seemed joking and friendly but then other times it's a flame fest I tried to ignore, and I had to turn voip off because I couldn't take the stupid conversations.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 6, 2014
												Dino D-Day is a fresh breath in the unfortunately stale age of Call of Duty. Like all games it has it's pro's and cons, but I feel the pros far out way the cons. The community is friendly and the game is simply entertaining. Over all I give the game 7.5/10The Pros:The community is friendly. The game's loading screens let and trailers let you know the game doesn't take itself seriously and the community seems to reflect the "It's just for fun" attitude. Newbie’s are always asking for help and the Vets are off to the rescue with quick replies.The Dino-factor.Adding in a handful of random dinosaurs with machine gun attached to their head makes it fun to play other characters for a change instead of the running shotgun or the always camping sniper, although those characters are open if that’s your style.The game offers a multiple maps and game play options.This is often taken for granted, “it's an online multiplayer game, of course it is going to have options!” Yes, but these add a certain flavor to each game and game play.The Cons:There is no tutorial and the manual is not always helpful. The game gives you some hints on the loading screens, but more often than not the Newbie’s, like myself, have had to take a break from chowing down on an Allied soldier or shooting dino's to ask for some help.The maps are often cluttered.It makes for great fun on some places but other maps just feel like they were thrown together quickly so that there was an extra map. One map even has two towers that allow you to spawn camp rather easily.The graphics aren't too modern.This one isn't a large concern of mine, I remember Goldeneye, still have it in my N64 and this is a large step away from the age of Doom. Still, I understand why some people could be put off by the raw graphic.

												I was not sure after purchasing dino horde if I should get this even on the cheap  . But with minutes left and abit of funny stuff watched on youtube I decided to grab it for £1.70 . Its far better than some would have u belive and is also very playable on a pad (certain classes suited more than others , I did very well for a first try with a pad) . Its very fun for a few hours at a time . I have only played one decent session with a most classes (no idea how to be a big trex yet) but will be back for more fun many times .. If we were back in the 80s/90s I would of spent my money 5 times over in the arcade already so walking away on day one chuffed . And many players . Not loads but at least 4 to 5 full rooms at all times I was on (early evening) with many more half full lobbies , which I found abit more stealthy and fun If u see it cheap then just grab it . If u Really Really love dinosaurs I see no reason why a full price purchase wouldnt satisfy your dino thirst . And if u are kinda sick of the same old modern shooters and miss the old days abit . number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
												Well, it seems games evolve with updates, so never tried dino d day in its early days, but people said it was bad. After 3 years of being released, I got it and all the bugs and glitches have been fixed. Didn't find any bug like animals floating etc. Regarding to gameplay, now it is more balanced, since you can go dino + soldiers (axis) vs dino + soldiers (allies). Before, only nazis had dinos. Although it could be named as a mod, dino d day is a very fun game, very arcade so don't compared it to COD or BF3/4.The animations of dinos are ok, the weapons are ok, and graphics, well, it is made in source engine (2004), so kind of meh.  But when deathmatching and combined with parade music of world war, it makes the game ridiculous in a good way. To kill some time is recommended. I wish it had more maps and game modes, the game offers little. So, buy it only on discount (50% off 0r 75% off)P.D I enjoyed more dino d day than titan fall and COD ghost.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 22, 2013
												This was my first honest-to-noodly-appendage first person shooter, and I *loved* it. I found learning the controls a bit tricky and the in-game help was a bit hit and miss on that front (perhaps it is geared more toward people who have fps experience rather than a beginner), but the game itself is pretty forgiving. My chief complaint with the game is the load time - I am used to tabbing in and out of games and found I needed to do it on this one to try and look up help with the controls. Trying to tab back in? Forget about it. The screen can take a number of minutes to load again, and with quick games this can mean you're out for an entire session (your teammates *love* that).The group I was playing with also was having a very difficult time setting up our own game with our own controls (we wanted to play in a group with a bunch of bots as our first experience with D D-D), and we never did manage to do it.In spite of the little quibbles, this game really is a lot of fun. I laughed quite a bit at someone in the chat complaining that the gun on his dinosaur wasn't as accurate as he wanted it to be because, well, Nazi dinosaurs. tldnr; NAZI DINOSAURS. EEEEEEEEEEEE!

												This game is fun and amusing.  It's all online play.  You can either play for the axis or the Allies.  The Axises have all the good dinosaurs.  Some of the maps have pretty powerful camping spots - which can be annoying and fun.  On some of the bigger maps you can play as a T-rex if you get a high enough kill streak.  There are different game modes as well.  A amusing, fast paced, easy to learn online shooter.

content:
Posted: January 2, 2014
												There's really no reason not to buy this game. There's no unlocking anything or improving weapons. You start the game with everything and it's just straight up who is better. Snipers are AWESOME and actually require some degree of skill. Also there's some dinos with guns strapped to their back. Random game modes on random maps. Changes it up quite a bit. It's never TDM over and over. Scoring is off for the rounds. You switch sides but the sides themselves are scored, not the teams that control the sides. So if it ends in a tie for the match, it can mean one team was just dominent.

												Balance is important for a game like this, and controls.  No matter how fun it is, the game needs these to be great.  Luckily, the controls are very tight and the game seems very balanced.  Each class is unique, and the dinosaurs are great to control and are more than just gimmiky, they offer great loadout options and are great for gameplay.  Furthremore, while the Nazis have dinosaur classes, the other human classes have a wide range of weaponry to counterack the dino-threat.  Playing as humans in this game is not as boring as you would think it is.    If you like TF2, then you'll really dig this game.  It feels like a TF2 with dinosaurs, as you'll often see every class from TF2 implemented in this (Save for the engineer and spy).  Whether or not you want to spend 10.00$ for a class based shooter that plays similarly to TF2(Which is free), that is up to you.  However, if you're itching for another multiplayer shooter where you can play as Nazi dinosaurs, or just looking for a really good time, then pick this game up!Kim Jong Un Approves.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 16, 2014
												I'd say this game is just a Call of Duty clone with dinosaurs, but it is actually quite different. Instead, it plays a lot like Team Fortress 2 (most likely because it runs off of what looks like the Source engine). The game doesn't fling you into a chincey "First person shooter...but with DINOSAURS!!!!11!!11!" mentality because the game is actually well balanced, with even the Tyrannosaurus Rex being well balanced. It features plenty of playable reptilian friends along with those of the homosapian nature, and neither class is overpowered. A definite buy (especially at it's 90% off sale at .99 cents)!PROS:Play as different dinosaurs that aren't gimmickyWell balanced game overallPretty good map designAudio is cleanDoesn't feel repititious like CoD or Battlefield because of the Dinosaur mechanic and their strengths and weaknessesDefinitely asking a good price for the gameCONS (with opinions):Game engine could've been better, something that doesn't feel too Valve-y, could've utilized higher detail engines (Unreal would've been perfect in my opinion).Even with the selection of Dinosaurs, more would've definitely been better.The wait to respawn mechanic gets old. Fast.Switching class in spawn kills you (and restarts the respawn timer).Other than that, the game is pretty good.IS IT WORTH YOUR TIME AND $$$ - YESWILL IT SATISFY YOUR DINO FPS HUNGER - YESIS THE GAME REALLY FUN AND FRESH FEELING - YESWILL THE GAME MAKE YOU RAGE - PROBABLY AT TIMESDO I DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS GAME - YOU BETCHA!Gameplay 9.5/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 1, 2015
												One of the most under rated shooters out there!How something like COD can get popular but original ideas like this get almost no credit I will never know, but that's besides the point, let's dive into my review, shall we?So lets start with the pros first:-A fun take on combat, with humans pitted against different dinosaurs-For the most part, the combat is pretty balanced. Different characters counter different dinosaurs, and vice versa. I have yet to have encountered something OP so far (though the jackrabbits can be pretty annoying)-Almost all the characters/dinos are well thought out, with actual backstories and some with special abilities!-Different dinos and (I think) different humans have different health bars. With this, comes some cons though. The tankiest dino can only move into places more into the open, because he's too fat to squeeze through doorways. I feel this is a good way to balance things-Awesome comics to read if you're interested in the backstory! (as you can tell by the trailers, it's pretty well thought out!)-MUTE BUTTON! THANK YOU!-Lots of new people trying out the game, so we're all on equal playing ground. Not a lot of sweaty tryhards here!And now.....To the cons:-Once you've played all the classes it gets a bit repetitive-The community isn't DEAD but it's starting to get there. Like I said, under rated games are...Under rated.-Basically almost always any gamemode besides TDM is dead...-Comics cost money on top of what you're paying for the game. It's only a buck but, come on!-The devs have sorta abandoned this game, we haven't had an update for a while other than the Last Stand DLC, WHICH ALSO COSTS MONEY.-Can be sorta overpriced when not on sale considering the ammount of people playing, so maybe get it only when it's 40% off or more. I got mine when it was 80% off for around a 2 dollars so make sure to do what I did!So, in conclusion I think I have fun on this game much more than having a bad time on it. Like I've said before it is an extremely under rated game IMHO and I hope this review will help you in the decision of if you're going to buy it or not.Have fun,-Monkey King

												Every once in a while I play a dumb game that gets a special place in my heart. Dino D-Day was one of those games. It's wonderful.A couple of the lobbies we joined seemed to have bugged out spitting dinos, that made quick work of the allies. The teams and classes themselves aren't particularly well balanced from what I saw, I think the Allies won 1 of the 5 games we played.I was sold this game in the promise of T Rex's but I couldn't find if and how I could play one, which was a little disappointing, but the Dino Tank made me forget about it pretty quickly.

content:
Posted: December 12, 2015
												I have over 600 games in my Steam account, and the vast majority of them are still unplayed. So now I'm dedicating an hour to each of these games and writing a series of One Hour Reviews. An hour isn't very long to judge a game on, so think of this as more of a first impression, and take this review in the spirit in which it's given. Be sure to read other reviews from players who have spent more time in the game. One Hour Reviews #47 - Dino D-DayThis is such a strange concept.  I can't even imagine where the developers came up with this idea of mixing Axis vs. Allies with dinosaurs.  What's even more strange is that this fusion somehow works.Playing the humans is much like you'd expect from a class based shooter, which choices like playing a medic, a sniper, or an assault type class.  The dinosaurs change things up by replacing weapons (for the most part, a few dinos still have mounted guns) with abilities like melee attacks or spitting poison.One thing I noticed though the distribution isn't exactly even.  The story (such as it is) has the Axis team responsible for bringing back the dinosaurs, so that side has virtually all of the dinos to choose from, while the Allies have only one dino (liberated from the other side).The game offers a variety of game types, which I noticed would change based on the map I selected.  The game comes with a decent number of maps to start with, and I also saw an option for loading custom maps.  Every map seemed to have the option for deathmatch, and capture the flag was another common option.  Deathmatch plays just like I expect it would.  Capture the flag looked pretty simplistic, there were only 3 flags to capture on the level I played.  I saw where a few maps had an objective based game type, but I didn't have time to check this out in my first hour of play.  Same goes for a deathmatch variant with T-Rexes.This is definitely one of those games that is really hard to evaluate on just an hour of play, but I had a lot of fun trying out everything.It is possible to play singleplayer with bots if thats your thing.  The bots have a difficulty level that you can select.  But obviously the real intent of this game is to play multiplayer.   There isn't any real matchmaking going on here, you just have a basic server select, and from there you can pick a side.  There didn't seem to be a huge number of people playing, but I also had no trouble finding an active server to hop into.Presentation wise the graphics are fine, but you aren't going to be blown away by anything.  It does have the typical options you'd expect like changing resolution, playing in a window (bordered or borderless) or fullscreen, and various other options as well.I can't give this game anywhere near a complete review with only an hour in, but I had a lot of fun in my first hour.  And for only $9.99, it looks like a good value for the variety of maps and game types you get.  I don't know that this would be a game to keep my attention for a long time, but it definitely makes for a nice alternative to the AAA shooters that are out there.

												The greatest one- WAS. IT WAS it! So, I wrote a critiqe when I played only some hours with that game- since that, there was a „jurrasic sized update”, so this is the time for  some new opinions.It was my favorite game, and then, the update came.Positive things:- develops are nice and great guys, sometimes plays together with players- new graphic is niice.Negatives:- After update, I cannot hit. Really, can not take a single shot- MISSED everything and couldnt use stairs :D Felt like lagging, but there was no lag.  So, for this game  I just bought a  new gaming mouse ( it was 50 Euro..). My accuracy get better, but nota s good as the „old game”- I bought the DLC. Definietly played ONE single TIME, since that, the game says: I havent got the DLC, plz buy it, if i wanna play. Feels like my money stolen. (yes, I uninstalled-installed the game, no, not solved..) - Some class specific abilities did not work. Medics,- ok, develops said, the work on it.  And Hissmans ptero? Call the ptero one time, and CAN NOT call again- it seems like „loading” after explode, but not load again. Never. - Ok, develops designed class-skins. Some have armour, compy have no. OK. Compy is an „in-building-assasin-class”  vulnerable and has no armour- BUT the assassin get the FUNKIEST colors? Really? - There are some class overpowered. For ex. Hardgrave. In old game there was a quit hardplay class, and now? - There are some new cheaters. They said, its just game „glitching” or  game-crash. Yeah, always the same guys :D always :D - Old players just extinct because of  update  - there was a little, but friendly community. We knew each other, we knew the others weaknesses- so, the games in this little community was about strategy. Not there are no „oldies” just russian 10 year old boys. This is the worst- we were in-game friends, and now..? /Sorry for very baad english :D/

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 30, 2015
												I wish there was an in between for yes and no reviews. I guess I'll simply say I recommend it "conditionally" and I'll explain what I mean.Buy this if...You want a fun and quirky game with dinosaurs:I have always loved dinosaurs since I was a kid... and as a teenager/young adult I also developed an interest in WWII history. This game meshes the two together and I find it quite interesting and funny. The game itself has some humor to it and some pretty crazy unrealistic stuff but it makes for some great gameplay. Playing as T-rex can be fun if you know what you are doing and don't just stand there in the open while everyone pelts you with grenades and rockets. Conversely, taking on a T-rex is also quite fun if you use the right strategy (the Hardgrave berserk strategy tends to be the fastest and most effective.) You are okay playing with bots sometimes:There aren't always many players online so some servers have bots. Depending on the class they are, the bots can be somewhat tricky to downright stupid. It can be pretty fun facing off against bots for practice, but after a while it can become too easy. If this is your first time playing, I recommend playing with bots to get a handle on the controls and character abilities, but don't expect actual players to act as bots do.It's on sale or free:I got this game completely free. I think $10 is an okay price for a game like this, but I've seen it often on sale for $0.99 so I recommend waiting for a sale. It might not be worth buying right away for most people.Don't buy this if...You want to play with lots of different people all the time:The amount of servers with people on them and the amount of people playing total tends to fluctuate (highest on weekends) but generally there is only a few servers and maybe only 1 or 2 that are actually full. Because of the small player base, chances are you will run into some of the same people a lot. I often see a few players who are either extremely good at this game or are hacking and this definitely changes up the game for people who are not on their team. If you play for a while you'll notice these same people always playing.You want a completely balanced and easy to learn game:Now... I'm not saying that the game is completely UNbalanced, nor am I saying that it is DIFFICULT to learn, but the classes can definitely take some getting used to and you might play a while without realizing the full potential of some of the characters or maps. As for balance, it is definitely debatable. The combat is asymmetrical, even for deathmatch. Each team has completely different classes except for maybe sniper and medic but even those classes have different guns and abilities. It can be argued that each team has a class to counter a class on another team. For example Nigel (bazooka/flamethrower) is a great anti-raptor character and Hardgrave (rifle and berserk mode) can easily bring down a T-Rex given the right circumstances. I find that the tide of the war greatly depends on the skills of the players. Sure, Axis dinosaurs seem OP at first, but the Allies can win easily if they know what they are doing and use the correct abilities. I find that the team that wins right off the bat tends to be the team that keeps winning regardless of alternating from Allies to Axis each round, and as I said there tends to be one or two players who carry the game. If they are on opposite teams, this will make for some tense gameplay. If they are on the same team, then you will steamroll the other team and it might be fun for a while until it gets repetitive or if you get tired of those carries taking all the kills.In conclusion...This game can be either really fun with money well-spent or a boring complete waste of time. It depends on what you are looking for. However, if you want to try something that will make you laugh and is fun to mess around in, I recommend picking this up if it reaches $0.99 on sale again.

content:
Posted: July 20, 2015
												This game is absurd, and fun to play... usually. Pitting the Allies vs the Axis in an alternate history where Germany clones dinosaurs to fuel their war effort, the Axis forces have a near monopoly on the Dinos. This doesn't mean that the Allies are any less fun to play though. Trigger, the Allies sole dino is one of the better ones, with a charge ability, and a solid machine gun to use. Playing at the Allies is more a straightforward FPS, with relatively standard classes. There is an assault, a sniper, a medic, all the regulars, and they do quite well against the dinosaurs, to the point that with a competitive team, the Axis forces have a bit of a harder time of things. Shotguns end dinos, sniper rifles end dinos from a distance. The Allies have a clear advantage on range in general. With a female french resistance medic, and a female sniper, I am also happy to see that I can play as a woman for once in an FPS. One that isn't merely relegated to a healer or noncombat class. This is pretty rare, and most people won't care, but I think it is pretty cool. Also of note is that several classes have area of effect buffs, such as accuracy or healing, allowing small squads to become even more deadly. Where the Allies have an advantage in range and teamwork, the Axis have a huge advantage in variety. Want to be fast and do melee? Try the Velociraptor, which can pounce, and generally kill people (if they are not killed during the feast animation) or the Microraptor, who can glide about the battlefield and spit poison. Want to bring in the big guns? Play as a Stygimolochs with a heavy machinegun or as a Spinosaurus, who is a miniature, low slung tank. On some maps you can even play as the legendary T-Rex.Both teams are very asymmetrical, but when dealing with new players, it seems the Allies will always get the win. Learning how to move as a dino is difficult, and many of the more powerful ones are large to the point that missing them is harder than not. My favorite thing is that the Allies are not seen as a writeoff. With some games (Pirates Vikings and Knights II comes to mind) there is a clear preference for the "cool" team, which the Axis easily could have been. Gladly this is not the case, and both teams have excellent up and downsides, encouraging you to play on both sides.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 30, 2015
												I wish there was an in between for yes and no reviews. I guess I'll simply say I recommend it "conditionally" and I'll explain what I mean.Buy this if...You want a fun and quirky game with dinosaurs:I have always loved dinosaurs since I was a kid... and as a teenager/young adult I also developed an interest in WWII history. This game meshes the two together and I find it quite interesting and funny. The game itself has some humor to it and some pretty crazy unrealistic stuff but it makes for some great gameplay. Playing as T-rex can be fun if you know what you are doing and don't just stand there in the open while everyone pelts you with grenades and rockets. Conversely, taking on a T-rex is also quite fun if you use the right strategy (the Hardgrave berserk strategy tends to be the fastest and most effective.) You are okay playing with bots sometimes:There aren't always many players online so some servers have bots. Depending on the class they are, the bots can be somewhat tricky to downright stupid. It can be pretty fun facing off against bots for practice, but after a while it can become too easy. If this is your first time playing, I recommend playing with bots to get a handle on the controls and character abilities, but don't expect actual players to act as bots do.It's on sale or free:I got this game completely free. I think $10 is an okay price for a game like this, but I've seen it often on sale for $0.99 so I recommend waiting for a sale. It might not be worth buying right away for most people.Don't buy this if...You want to play with lots of different people all the time:The amount of servers with people on them and the amount of people playing total tends to fluctuate (highest on weekends) but generally there is only a few servers and maybe only 1 or 2 that are actually full. Because of the small player base, chances are you will run into some of the same people a lot. I often see a few players who are either extremely good at this game or are hacking and this definitely changes up the game for people who are not on their team. If you play for a while you'll notice these same people always playing.You want a completely balanced and easy to learn game:Now... I'm not saying that the game is completely UNbalanced, nor am I saying that it is DIFFICULT to learn, but the classes can definitely take some getting used to and you might play a while without realizing the full potential of some of the characters or maps. As for balance, it is definitely debatable. The combat is asymmetrical, even for deathmatch. Each team has completely different classes except for maybe sniper and medic but even those classes have different guns and abilities. It can be argued that each team has a class to counter a class on another team. For example Nigel (bazooka/flamethrower) is a great anti-raptor character and Hardgrave (rifle and berserk mode) can easily bring down a T-Rex given the right circumstances. I find that the tide of the war greatly depends on the skills of the players. Sure, Axis dinosaurs seem OP at first, but the Allies can win easily if they know what they are doing and use the correct abilities. I find that the team that wins right off the bat tends to be the team that keeps winning regardless of alternating from Allies to Axis each round, and as I said there tends to be one or two players who carry the game. If they are on opposite teams, this will make for some tense gameplay. If they are on the same team, then you will steamroll the other team and it might be fun for a while until it gets repetitive or if you get tired of those carries taking all the kills.In conclusion...This game can be either really fun with money well-spent or a boring complete waste of time. It depends on what you are looking for. However, if you want to try something that will make you laugh and is fun to mess around in, I recommend picking this up if it reaches $0.99 on sale again.

												Do you like World War II? OF COURSE, IT'S AWESOME!Do you like Dinosaurs?OF COURSE, THEY'RE AWESOME!Do you like Nazis?If you answered yes, you need serious psychological help.Anyhow, your political views are none of my concern.If you answered yes to the first 2 questions, then you will enjoy this game.After all, what could possibly be better than shooting a bunch of one-testicled Dinosaurian reptiles who have been trained to gun down the enemy and/or throw goats of death at them by Adolf and Fegelein themselves? I'll tell you what could be better. Shooting a bunch of one-testicled Dinosaurian reptiles who have been trained to gun down the enemy and/or throw goats of death at them by Adolf and Fegelein themselves AND can♥♥♥♥♥♥on you. This is a wonderful game where the objective is to kill these cryptorchidic reptiles before they can rip your face off and♥♥♥♥♥♥down your throat, or throw goats at you until you are so♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥off that you desert the war. Or, on the other hand, if you have ♥♥♥♥ed up- I mean... highly right wing political views, you will have to throw goats at and♥♥♥♥♥♥on the enemy, but here's the catch, the brits have captured and trained their very own dino as well, and he is out there to kill you along with the stereotypically british/american/french allied troops. Although to be honest, it's not a catch, he in fact has no testicles, as opposed to the mighty cryptorchidic dinosaurian reptiles of the axis. Also, one of the Americans thought it would be fun to circumsize him while he slept. Eugh. Anyway, you must guide your one-balled reptiles into war and have them defeat the nasty hoomans, because, you know, hitler. content:
Posted: June 9, 2016
												The War of 1812 was a military conflict that lasted from June 18, 1812 to February 18, 1815, fought by the United States of America against Great Britain, its North American colonies, and its North American Indian allies. Historians in the United States and Canada see it as a war in its own right, but Europeans sometimes see it as a minor theatre of the Napoleonic Wars, as it was caused by issues related to that war (especially the Continental System). By the war's end in early 1815 the key issues had been resolved and peace came with no boundary changes.The United States declared war for several reasons, including trade restrictions brought about by the British war with France, the impressment of as many as 10,000 American merchant sailors into the Royal Navy,[5] British support for Native American tribes fighting American settlers on the frontier, outrage over insults to national honor during the Chesapeake–Leopard Affair, and possible American interest in annexing British territory.[6] The primary British war goal was to defend their North American colonies, although they also hoped to set up a neutral Indian buffer state in the Midwest.The war was fought in three theatres. First, at sea, warships and privateers of each side attacked the other's merchant ships, while the British blockaded the Atlantic coast of the United States and mounted large raids in the later stages of the war. Second, land and naval battles were fought on the U.S.–Canadian frontier. Third, large-scale battles were fought in the Southern United States and Gulf Coast. At the end of the war, both sides signed and ratified the Treaty of Ghent and, in accordance with the treaty, returned occupied land, prisoners of war and captured ships (though neither side returned the other's warships due to frequent re-commissioning upon capture) to its pre-war owner and resumed friendly trade relations without restriction.With the majority of its land and naval forces tied down in Europe fighting the Napoleonic Wars, the British used a predominantly defensive strategy in the Provinces of Upper and Lower Canada. Early victories over poorly-led U.S. armies, such as in the Battle of Queenston Heights, demonstrated that the conquest of the Canadas would prove more difficult than anticipated. Despite this, the U.S. was able to inflict serious defeats on Britain's Native American allies, ending the prospect of an Indian confederacy and an independent Native American state in the Midwest under British sponsorship. U.S. forces were also able to make several gains and score victories on the Canadian frontier; taking control of Lake Erie in 1813, seizing western parts of Upper Canada. However, a large-scale U.S. attempt to capture Montreal was repulsed in November 1813. Despite the major U.S. victory at Chippawa on July 5, 1814, serious U.S. attempts to fully conquer Upper Canada were ultimately abandoned following the bloody Battle of Lundy's Lane on July 25, 1814. The U.S. then fell back roughly 30 km (19 mi) from Lundy's Lane to Fort Erie, where they withstood a siege for several months. The British eventually withdrew, but as winter set in, the Americans demolished the fort and fell back across the Niagara.In April 1814, with the defeat of Napoleon, the British adopted a more aggressive strategy, sending larger invasion armies and tightening their naval blockade. However, with the end of the Napoleonic Wars in Europe, both governments were eager for a return to normality and peace negotiations began in Ghent in August 1814. In the Deep South, General Andrew Jackson destroyed the military strength of the Muscogee (Creek) Nation at the Battle of Horseshoe Bend. In September 1814, the British won the Battle of Hampden, allowing them to occupy eastern Maine, and the British victory at the Battle of Bladensburg in August 1814 allowed them to capture and burn Washington, D.C. They were repulsed, however, in an attempt to take Baltimore and Fort Bowyer, and during their assault at Fayal. An American victory in September 1814 at the Battle of Plattsburgh repulsed the British invasions of New York, which, along with pressure from merchants on the British government, prompted British diplomats to drop their demands at Ghent for an independent native buffer state and territorial claims that London previously sought. Given that it took six weeks for ships to cross the Atlantic, news of the peace treaty did not arrive before the British suffered a major defeat at New Orleans in January 1815.[7]In the United States, late victories over invading British armies at the battles of Plattsburg, Baltimore (inspiring the United States national anthem, "The Star-Spangled Banner") and New Orleans produced a sense of euphoria over a "second war of independence" against Britain.[8][9] The war ended on a high note for Americans, winning the final engagements of the war and bringing an "Era of Good Feelings" in which partisan animosity nearly vanished in the face of strengthened American nationalism. The war was also a major turning point in the development of the U.S. military. The poor performance of several U.S. militia units, particularly during the 1812–13 invasions of Canada and the 1814 defence of Washington, convinced the U.S. government of the need to move away from its Revolutionary-era reliance on militia and focus on creating a more professional regular force. Spain was involved in fighting in Florida but was not an official belligerent; some Spanish forces fought alongside the British during the Occupation of Pensacola. The U.S. took permanent ownership of Spain's Mobile District.In Upper and Lower Canada, British and local Canadian militia victories over invading U.S. armies became iconic and promoted the development of a distinct Canadian identity, which included strong loyalty to Britain. Today, particularly in Ontario, memory of the war retains its significance, because the defeat of the invasions ensured that the Canadas would remain part of the British Empire, rather than be annexed by the United States. In Canada, numerous ceremonies took place in 2012 to commemorate the war, offer historical lessons and celebrate 200 years of peace across the border.[10] The conflict has not been commemorated on nearly the same level in the modern-day United States, though it is still taught as an important part of early American history,[11] and Dolley Madison's and Andrew Jackson's respective roles in the war are especially emphasized.[12][13] The war is scarcely remembered in Britain, being heavily overshadowed by the much larger Napoleonic Wars occurring in Europe.

content:
Posted: November 11, 2016
												Dino D Day is a fantastic and honestly underrated game. The game started out as a Source mod that eventually got to star in its own show! The game is in an alternate universe where the Third Reich somehow brought back dinosaurs through science! The game pits German soldiers and dinosaurs vs allied soldiers and a single dinosaur. The gameplay is smooth, which is from what you would expect from a source engine game. It's easy to learn, somewhat easy to master, and an absolute blast to play. The game has a few hundred people playing it, so finding a populated server isn't difficult to find. It's only a pity that more people don't play it. When it goes on sale, do you and your friends a favor and buy like 10 copies at 99 cents a piece. The game is silly, fun and the playerbase is friendly!

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 4
												A barebones multiplayer game that would have felt dated if it had been released 10 years ago.There are very few people playing this game, mostly people with 900 hours logged in it, or the devs themselves. So have fun as a noob getting repeatedly killed by the few hardcore fans who are still playing.Actual gameplay is your basic bunny-hop shooting simulator. Everybody jumps all the time. Somehow people will hit each other. Hit detection seems way off, and all guns are wildly inaccurate and have oddly short ranges. MGs overheat after 2 seconds of firing. Grenades appear in mid air in front of your character before sailing off in a seemingly random trajectory.Graphics are meh.Dinosaur classes are completely broken. Several of them don't have guns, so enjoy chasing enemies that are bunny-hopping backwards as they riddle you with bullets. Most people seem to just play the human soldiers, removing the shred of uniqueness this game possessed. Often they have convoluted tactics in order to be useful. The Compy, for instance is a suicide bomber with a pathetically weak normal attack and almost no health, but must kill enemies in order to make the blast more powerful. This is nigh impossible and about as much fun as it sounds.There are the expected modes, team deathmatch, king of the hill, etc. Unfortunately, with so few players, there is pretty much only one populated server up at any given time.In conclusion: The game isn't very good and its servers are all but dead, but at least I got to shoot a T-Rex in the butt with a flamethrower.

												I honestly did not expect this game to be so much fun. Think Team Fortress 2, but with goats and dinosaurs in a World War II setting. I currently have nothing to complain about with this game because right off the bat everything feels balanced and there are no major bugs. The only way this game could be ruined would be if they pulled a valve and started adding hats. I'd really hate to start getting killed by a veloci-raptor wearing 20 fedoras.

content:
Posted: June 16, 2015
												Though it's now 4 years old, I'd still recommend this over any vanilla shooter like any Counter Strike or CoD or whatever. T-Rex is fun, raptor is fun, cannon slowish-dino is fun, mg dino is fun, throw the rabbits watch the lulz human is fun, pretty much lots of fun and Source engine reliability & features. Course, its mp only and I don't know the state of the servers anymore but I have a feeling people always play because whenever I go back there are people playing. But then I don't play fps very much any more.like they said in Futurama:Mr Mayor! I don't see how that's humane!It is for the spectators because at least it isn't boring!

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 19, 2016
												I'll come right out and say it, if you look at this game and for some odd reason expect a game about nazi dinosaurs to be a super serious competitive game or the next call of duty, you're obviously going to be disappointed. However, if you're looking for something you can play for a few laughs, have some fun with your friends, or just relax a little bit, you'll be as satisfied with this game as I was. It gives you a good amount of classes, interesting places to fight in, an open skybox (which can let some parkour get you on top of buildings for some amusing tactics, goats, and even a dlc which goes on sale for as cheap as the game ($1). Personally I'd recommend getting this on sale, or finding a nice bundle where you can get it. So far I've given about 9 copies away to some of my good friends if that says anything about the enjoyment and amusing nature this gives off.

content:
Posted: June 17, 2015
												Bought it on sale for 50 cents.  Would be worth the full price IMO.  Win or lose I don't seem to really care.  I just have a lot of fun playing it.  So far of all the games I've purchased during the summer sale this has been the msot fun.+Dinosaurs+Multiple Classes+Moderatley Balanced+Decent sized community+Easy to learn+Runs smooth on a moderate PC+Community is civilized.  Have yet to find any rude or negativer players- Lack of customization.  Some Of the classes allow for changing a single weapon, not much in the way of a personal loadoutOverall I would give this game a solid 8 out of 10, considering what it is.  A cheap, fun, mindless, good way to waste some time and enjoy doing it.  It's far from a perfect game, but its charming in its own imperfect ways.

content:
Posted: November 10, 2015
												This game is great. I got it on sale for $0.99 (it is on sale quite frequently) and I must say: this game is a steal at that price. It has a pretty funny sense of humour and it is fun to play as the various dinosaurs. I particularly like using the Compy :P I do think the Allies are a bit OP as they win a solid 75% of the time and some maps people will launch grenades from spawn or snipe your spawn from across the map and it does get annoying but otherwise it's pretty great. I recommend whole hearted.

content:
Posted: October 20, 2015
												Reminds me of the days of Counter Strike: Source.What great fun it is to shoot a Nazi Dino, over and over and over, then play as one!Multi-player only done right, with just good gameplay, thats it, cheap, no bs, no microtrans whatever, just good gunplay.Play as Allies, with many classes, different guns, and secondaries (no loadouts) .Or Play as the Nazi, with human gunners (which I love, MP40 is god) and 5-6 different Dinos.Ranging from Raptors, to even T-Rex. They all seem so well balanced.I paid 99 cents for this game, but it is worth it. Countless hourrs of Multiplayer fun, voice chatting, and spraying Dinos with bullets, all day, I did it.One problem I have. Late night, when I got some beers and wanna play @ like 1am or so, the servers sometimes are dead. and bots suck.I rec this game 9/10. I hope people buy it, and tell your friends, this is one of the best multiplayer experiences I have ever had, Counter Strike: Source being my favorite.

												This game was worth every cent - all 99 of them. It's a great game to join for a round or two when you have nothing better to do and the other games in your library don't call out to be used. That said, it's far too unpolished and even uncut to be worth full-price, but it is very charming and unique, and I am glad to own it. If you have a lot of money and just want to try something fun - get it. Otherwise wait for another sale and get it then.

												This game is great. I got it on sale for $0.99 (it is on sale quite frequently) and I must say: this game is a steal at that price. It has a pretty funny sense of humour and it is fun to play as the various dinosaurs. I particularly like using the Compy :P I do think the Allies are a bit OP as they win a solid 75% of the time and some maps people will launch grenades from spawn or snipe your spawn from across the map and it does get annoying but otherwise it's pretty great. I recommend whole hearted.

content:
Posted: June 17, 2015
												Bought it on sale for 50 cents.  Would be worth the full price IMO.  Win or lose I don't seem to really care.  I just have a lot of fun playing it.  So far of all the games I've purchased during the summer sale this has been the msot fun.+Dinosaurs+Multiple Classes+Moderatley Balanced+Decent sized community+Easy to learn+Runs smooth on a moderate PC+Community is civilized.  Have yet to find any rude or negativer players- Lack of customization.  Some Of the classes allow for changing a single weapon, not much in the way of a personal loadoutOverall I would give this game a solid 8 out of 10, considering what it is.  A cheap, fun, mindless, good way to waste some time and enjoy doing it.  It's far from a perfect game, but its charming in its own imperfect ways.

content:
Posted: November 13, 2015
												I tried to play the game, but it put me in an empty lobby with no goal or objective which was both stupid and lame. It wasn't even a tutorial, it was just a "wander around and figure♥♥♥♥♥♥out"- empty map. Then, when I tried a second time to play it, it crashed my entire computer! What a waste- even if it was on sale. Even Orion Prelude was better than this garbage. Its normally 10 bucks and I can't even get it to work/ play properly. Maybe its just me, but this isn't worth it imo. Does't even work properly.Controller support is a joke. Took me several minutes to just get the left movement stick and the right trigger to work. The button configuration choice was also hidden so I couldn't see what the heck I was even doing/ choosing. I still only got three buttons to work. Jump, basic attack on dino, and move/ look. Movement and look should be on different keys/ buttons, I mean seriously. Annoying much? Gameplay? Crashed my entire computer at character select and wouldn't properly load me into a game/ lobby. I tried to load up task-manager, but that didn't work so I had to restart. I don't believe I've been able to get any actual play time, but then again I lost interest/ care after having to RESTART my computer. It looked like it should have been a fairly decent and playable game, but nope. Can't say I trust the game much after having to restart my computer to deal with a game related crash. I couldn't see my mouse or do anything.At the moment I also have a bunch of animals annoying me...*sigh*

content:
Posted: May 30, 2016
												A very great game.This game is one of the few who can run at normal graphics which is so good since I have to render my games a ton of years.Let's get to the point.-Pros:-TF2-styled game with dinosaurs. A TF2-like game is always welcomed in my library and I don't like, but LOVE dinosaurs so 10 points.-You can play as a suicidal bomber. My newest job in TF2 is to scream ALLAHU AKBAR and laugh as they kick me. This will make it funnier to blow myself up. 20-Runs greatly with normal graphics. I have stated this above. 30 points.-Huge diversity of characters. TF2 has 9 classes. In this game it's 8 for each team (Allies and Axis). 16 total classes. 40 points!-Cons:-Game can be hard for newbies like me. -10 points.-None other than above. No points.Overall: 9/10. I'm still exploring the game, so more will be added soon. Also you can grab goats and kill people with them by throwing them wich reminds me of Goat Simulator and thus, a huge boost.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 13, 2015
												I tried to play the game, but it put me in an empty lobby with no goal or objective which was both stupid and lame. It wasn't even a tutorial, it was just a "wander around and figure♥♥♥♥♥♥out"- empty map. Then, when I tried a second time to play it, it crashed my entire computer! What a waste- even if it was on sale. Even Orion Prelude was better than this garbage. Its normally 10 bucks and I can't even get it to work/ play properly. Maybe its just me, but this isn't worth it imo. Does't even work properly.Controller support is a joke. Took me several minutes to just get the left movement stick and the right trigger to work. The button configuration choice was also hidden so I couldn't see what the heck I was even doing/ choosing. I still only got three buttons to work. Jump, basic attack on dino, and move/ look. Movement and look should be on different keys/ buttons, I mean seriously. Annoying much? Gameplay? Crashed my entire computer at character select and wouldn't properly load me into a game/ lobby. I tried to load up task-manager, but that didn't work so I had to restart. I don't believe I've been able to get any actual play time, but then again I lost interest/ care after having to RESTART my computer. It looked like it should have been a fairly decent and playable game, but nope. Can't say I trust the game much after having to restart my computer to deal with a game related crash. I couldn't see my mouse or do anything.At the moment I also have a bunch of animals annoying me...*sigh*

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 12, 2013
												Dino D-Day is a fun twist on an overused premise Allies vs Axis, this time around however we all have genetically engineered dinosaur soldiers, what could go wrong? they could eat Santa that's what! There will be more of that craziness when you try the game but be sure here and now its not all craziness there is a lot of action and a good amount of strategy in here as well with the way different classes play. Not many players most of the time ,but then again  the game never really took off, the only way to know if you like it is to try it, just remember to spread word of your experiences to friends maybe we can make the game more popular.Update: 7/2/14     I thought at the time of the original review that the game would end up pretty barren, with a very small to no community at the time of my original review. all this time later I am glad to be proven wrong, the population of the game has actually increased at the time of this update. I hear there is also new content on the way, so its a great day for it to be Dino D-Day!Update:  10/9/14   We got our first DLC released recently. Its a paid DLC so I have not had the chance to try it, but I have not heard any complaints yet, besides people wanting it free. The game is still looking good.

content:
Posted: June 6, 2015
												Unfortunately there is not many people playing this title and here's a possible reason why. I bought this some time ago but hadn't tried it so I attempted to give it a try a few days ago and on spawning in the only server map with more than a couple of players on each side I found myself  floating in mid air unable to do anything other than spin around, I restarted the game several times trying to get to play but each time I ended up in the same predicament. Unsure what to do I asked the other players what to do via the ingame text system and the only responses I got varied from f-ing noob to names Steam will simply blank out if written. Personally I don't care one iota if someone wants to cuss me in the heat of battle but when a new player is greeted by this are you surprised the game ends up with only a server or two being used properly. 06/06/2015My advice is do not waste your money on a title that's going nowhere. The vast majority of servers are empty and that's no surprise.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
												I'll be honest. A while ago when many said this game was sub-par, I loved it. I loved it's fluidness and perfectly running, smooth gameplay. With this new 'Jurrassic sized update' they took everything I loved about this game and put it on frappe in the blender. I have never been so disappointed in a single update in my entire life. My PC is by far good enough to run this game, thus that is for sure not the issue. I am perplexed as to why the developers would ruin such a great game. A few things I observed that were great before but are not now are as follows; -Animations (Don't even get me started)-Performance(Smoothness)-The menu system-General server performance-Audio quality and content-The overall charm of the game     This was my go-to game for the longest time but, in it's current nearing unplayable state I could never tell anyone I know to play this game. As of this review, the game is honestly bad. It pains me to even write this. Don't play this game right now.

Posted: August 20, 2016
												This is a PvP only FPS.   Unfortunately theme comes before balance, so as a PvP only game, it's immediately frustrating.   This would have been tolerable if there was a major PvE component, but there isn't. Also, the game hasn't been kept up to date and doesn't work properly on Windows 10 if you run at 4K - so beware - this game may not work for you at all.

												im easy to please.but this game is just off, i was completely dissatisfied with the game, i cant remember the last time i felt that way about a game.either way, to be fair as this is a review of the game and not my tastes:i can imagine younger players enjoying this. didnt run into any issues, well made runs on minimal pc requirements.non stop action, spawn and start shooting opponents within a few seconds.still a good amount of servers with a good community of players.none of which i have ever heard talk or type lol.just a game you can kill time with senseless shooting and running around.Dodging around and hiding for a few tense moments as you try not to be seen by the T-Rex.overall; ill have to give it a thumbs up fun for alot of other peoplesadly not in the slightest for me.

content:
Posted: February 14, 2015
												I could say without a doubt, that even though this game has not really been a favourite among gamers (considering the many negative reviews I've read on it), I found it to be rather fun.... For a short while. Dead servers, not much replayability,  and clunky controls (Only with the dinosaurs, in my case). Out of the few many created with the Source engine, this could probably be the worst. And yet, I will say this. It's fun, and worth coming back to. Let's hope they give us another one!
